column4: Ihr habt verloren, aber noch ist nicht alles verloren. Wenn Ihr euch erneut behaupten wollt, muss Euer Clan die Kontrolle über den Schwarzfels übernehmen und Vorbereitungen für eine erneute Invasion treffen.

column2: No, there is another way to proceed.
column3: Non, il y a d'autre manières de procéder.
column4: Nein, es gibt noch einen anderen Weg.

column2: The Alliance has interfered in our conquests! If we want to rule Azeroth, then we must completely crush this Alliance. This war will be more difficult than any other we have fought, but if we win, there will be no one else who can dare to challenge the Horde!
column3: L'Alliance s'est interposé lors de nos conquêtes ! Si nous voulons diriger Azeroth, alors nous devons complètement écraser cette Alliance. Cette guerre sera plus difficile que toutes celles que nous avons combattues, mais si nous gagnons, il ne restera plus personne pour oser défier la Horde !
column4: Die Allianz hat unsere Eroberungen vereitelt! Wenn wir Azeroth beherrschen wollen, müssen wir sie um jeden Preis vernichten. Dieser Krieg wird der Härteste sein, den wir je geführt haben, aber wenn wir gewinnen, wird sich niemand mehr wagen, die Horde herauszufordern!

column2: The New Leader of the Faction
column3: Le nouveau dirigeant de la faction
column4: Neuer Fraktionsführer

column2: [From.GetDynName] can not be the leader of the faction anymore. In these dark days of war, control over a faction must be maintained by its most powerful member - in this case, the [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetFullBaseName], under the leadership of [Root.GetTitledFirstName]. It is hoped that their strength will change the fortunes of this faction for the better!
column3: [From.GetDynName] ne peut plus être le dirigeant de cette faction désormais. En ces jours sombres de guerre, le controle d'une faction doit être maintenue par ses plus puissants membres - Dans ce cas, le [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetFullBaseName], sous la direction de [Root.GetTitledFirstName]. Il est espéré que leur puissance fera varier la chance de cette faction pour le meilleur.
column4: [From.GetDynName] kann nicht mehr unser Anführer sein. In diesen dunklen Tagen des Krieges muss der Größte unsere Fraktion anführen - in diesem Fall, [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetFullBaseName] unter der Führung von [Root.GetTitledFirstName]. Wir müssen beten, dass ihre Stärke die Fraktion zu neuem Ruhm führen wird.

column2: Let's go!
column3: Allons-y !
column4: Auf geht's!

column2: You are slowly making your way through the dark streets towards your goal. Suddenly, you hear the sound of approaching footsteps and the clank of armor. Out in the street in front of you, you notice a few men with the emblems of the local guard on their shields. You have some gold and your weapon, but on your right, you notice a completely dark alley. What will you do?
column3: Vous avancez lentement dans les rues sombre jusqu'à votre but. Soudain, vous entendez des pas approchant, et des cliquetis d'armure. En face de vous, vous remarquez quelques hommes avec l'insigne des gardes locaux sur leurs boucliers. Vous avez un peu d'or et votre arme, mais sur votre droite, vous remarquez une allée plongée dans le noir. Qu'allez-vous faire ?
column4: Ihr geht langsam durch die dunklen Straßen auf Euer Ziel zu. Plötzlich vernehmt Ihr das Geräusch sich nähernder Schritte und das metallische Scheppern von Rüstungen. Auf der Straße vor Euch gehen ein paar Männer mit den Emblemen der örtlichen Wachen auf ihren Schilden. Ihr führt etwas Gold mit Euch und Eure Waffe steckt im Gürtel, rechts von Euch befindet sich eine völlig dunkle Gasse. Was tut Ihr?

column2: Try to negotiate.
column3: Essayer de négocier.
column4: Versuchen zu verhandeln.

column2: Rush to the alley and wait there.
column3: Courire jusqu'à l'allée et attendre là-bas.
column4: In die Gasse eilen und dort wartet.

column2: There is no time. Charge!
column3: Il n'y a pas le temps. Chargez !
column4: Dafür habe ich keine Zeit. Angriff!

column2: You step out of the shadows and begin to make a fool of yourself, claiming that you became lost at night while hurrying to visit relatives. But this tale has no effect on the guard, even when you take out a small bag of gold! If you don't do something, you could spend the night imprisoned - or perhaps far worse.
column3: Vous sortez de l'ombre et commencez à jouer l'imbécile, clamant que vous vous êtes perdu à la nuit tombée alors que vous alliez rendre visite à des connaissances. Mais cette histoire n'a pas d'effet sur les gardes...Même lorsque vous sortez un petit sac d'or ! Si vous ne faites pas quelque chose maintenant, vous pourriez passer la nuit en prison...Ou peut-être pire.
column4: Ihr tretet aus dem Schatten hervor und beginnt, Euch zum Narren zu machen, [From.Getderdie] sich nachts auf dem Weg zu [From.GetHerHis]en Verwandten verirrt hat. Aber diese Geschichte überzeugt die Wachen nicht... selbst als Ihr einen kleinen Beutel Gold hervorholt! Wenn Ihr nichts unternehmt, könntet Ihr diese Nacht in einer Zelle verbringen... oder vielleicht auch schlimmeres.

column2: You try to retreat into the dark alley, but one of the guards has noticed you and called out. You began to make a fool of yourself, claiming that you became lost at night while hurrying to visit relatives. But this tale has no effect on the guard. If you don't do something, you could spend a night imprisoned - or perhaps far worse.
column3: Vous essayez de vous replier dans l'allée sombre mais l'un des gardes vous remarque et vous appel. Vous commencez à jouer à l'imbécile, clamant que vous vous êtes perdu à la nuit tombée alors que vous rendiez visite à des connaissances. Mais cette histoire n'a pas d'effet sur les gardes. Si vous ne faites rien, vous pourriez passer la nuit en prison...Ou pire encore.
column4: Ihr versucht, Euch in eine dunkle Gasse zurückzuziehen, aber eine der Wachen hat Euch bemerkt und ruft Euch an. Ihr beginnt, Euch zum Narren zu machen, [From.Getderdie] sich nachts auf dem Weg zu [From.GetHerHis]en Verwandten verirrt hat. Aber diese Geschichte überzeugt die Wachen nicht. Wenn Ihr nichts unternehmt, werdet Ihr diese Nacht möglicherweise in einer Zelle verbringen... oder vielleicht auch schlimmeres.

column2: Draw your weapon.
column3: Attraper une arme.
column4: Waffe ziehen.

column2: Run!
column3: Courrez !
column4: Davonlaufen.

column2: You come to your senses in a cramped room. Remembering last night, you realize that this is a prison cell. Your mission has failed. The cult will not be pleased about such news.
column3: Vous revenez à vous dans une pièce étroite. Vous vous remémorez la nuit dernière, et réalisez que c'est une cellule de prison. La mission a échoué. Le culte ne sera pas satisfait de telles nouvelles.
column4: Ihr kommt in einem sehr kleinen Raum zur Besinnung. Wenn Ihr Euch an die letzte Nacht erinnert, wird Euch klar, dass Ihr in einer Gefängniszelle seid. Die Mission ist fehlgeschlagen. Der Kult wird mit solcherlei Nachrichten nicht zufrieden sein.

column2: You successfully bribed the guards and reached the barn. Soon, all the grain stocks are infected with the plague. But what will you do with any witnesses and neighbours? Wouldn't it be better to get rid of them in the name of the Lich King?
column3: Vous avez pu corrompre les gardes et atteindre la grange. Bientôt, tout les stocks de grains sont infectés avec la Peste. Mais qu'allez vous faire des témoins et des voisins ? Ne serait-il pas plus utile de se débarasser d'eux au nom du Roi-Liche.
column4: Ihr habt die Wachen erfolgreich bestochen und habt die Scheune erreicht. Bald schon waren alle Getreidevorräte mit der Pest verseucht. Aber was werdet Ihr mit den Zeugen und Nachbarn anfangen? Wäre es nicht besser, sie im Namen des Lichkönigs zu beseitigen?

column2: You successfully disappeared from the patrol and reached the barn. Soon, all the grain stocks are infected with the plague. But what will you do with any witnesses and neighbours? Wouldn't it be better to get rid of them in the name of the Lich King?
column3: Vous avez disparu avec succès du champ de vision de la patrouille et avez atteints la grange. Bientôt, tout les stocks de grains sont infectés avec la Peste. Mais qu'allez-vous faire avec des témoins et des voisins. Ne serait-il pas mieux de s'en débarasser au nom du Roi-Liche ?
column4: Ihr seid der Patrouille erfolgreich ausgewichen und habt die Scheune erreicht. Bald schon waren alle Getreidevorräte mit der Pest verseucht. Aber was werdet Ihr mit den Zeugen und Nachbarn anfangen? Wäre es nicht besser, sie im Namen des Lichkönigs zu beseitigen?

column2: You killed all the guards and reached the barn. Soon, all the grain stocks are infected with the plague. But what will you do with any witnesses and neighbours? Wouldn't it be better to get rid of them in the name of the Lich King?
column3: Vous avez abattus tout les gardes et atteint la grange. Bientôt, tout les stocks de grains sont infectés avec la Peste. Mais que ferez-vous avec des témoins et des voisins. Ne serait-il pas mieux de s'en débarasser au nom du Roi-Liche ?
column4: Ihr habt alle Wachen getötet und habt die Scheune erreicht. Bald schon waren alle Getreidevorräte mit der Pest verseucht. Aber was werdet Ihr mit den Zeugen und Nachbarn anstellen? Wäre es nicht besser, sie im Namen des Lichkönigs zu beseitigen?

column2: Eliminate them, but only if it's necessary.
column3: Eliminez-les, cela est nécessaire.
column4: Löscht sie aus, wenn nötig.

column2: Death shall cleanse the world!
column3: La mort purifiera ce monde !
column4: Tod soll diese Welt reinigen!

column2: It was a long night. The dawn is coming, but you are already far from the city. Its inhabitants will remember this night for a long time, and the cult will be sure to reward you generously for this mission.
column3: Ce fut une longue nuit. L'aube arrive mais vous êtes déjà loin de la ville. Ses habitants se souviendront de cette nuit pendant encore longtemps, et le Culte vous récompensera généreusement pour cette mission, c'est une certitude.
column4: Es war eine lange Nacht. Die Dämmerung bricht heran, als Ihr schon weit von der Stadt entfernt seid. Ihre Bewohner werden sich lange an diese Nacht erinnern, und der Kult wird Euch für diese Mission sicherlich großzügig belohnen.

column2: After waiting for a good moment, you and acolytes of the cult attack the guards from the shadows. They were caught off guard, but they are well armed and have already killed many acolytes. You need to intervene immediately!
column4: Nachdem Ihr auf den richtigen Moment gewartet habt, greift Ihr zusammen mit einigen Akolyten des Kults die Wachen aus den Schatten heraus an. Diese sind aber gut bewaffnet und in der Lage, viele Akolyten zu töten, obwohl ihr sie überrumpelt hattet. Ihr müsst sofort eingreifen!

column2: Starts a fight with §Y[target_enemy.GetTitledName]§!.
column4: Beginnt einen Kampf mit §Y[target_enemy.GetTitledName]§!.

column2: You take a scalpel and look upon your victim's hamstrings and muscles. There are pretty good samples here, although you could wish for better. However, you can definitely get a lot of useful flesh from this body. Well, let's get to work! You stab the scalpel into your victim's flesh, and their screams begin to fill the room.
column4: Ihr nehmt das Skalpell auf und betrachtest die Sehnen und Muskeln des Opfers. Ziehmlich gute Probe... obwohl Ihr euch besseres gewünscht hattet. Aus diesem Körper könnt Ihr trotzdem viel nützliches Fleisch gewinnen. Auf ans Werk! Ihr stecht mit dem Skalpell ins Fleisch Eures Opfers und der Raum wird erfüllt von seinem Schreien.

column2: You take a scalpel and look upon your victim's hamstrings and muscles. This time, you have a very fleshy sample. You're sure you can get a lot of useful flesh from this body. Well, let's get to work! You stab the scalpel into your victim's flesh, and their screams start to fill the room.
column4: Ihr nehmt das Skalpell auf und betrachtest die Sehnen und Muskeln des Opfers. Dieses Mal habt Ihr eine sehr kräftige Probe erhalten. Ohne Zweifel könnt Ihr viel nützliches Fleisch von diesem Körper bekommen. Auf ans Werk! Ihr stecht mit dem Skalpell ins Fleisch Eures Opfers und der Raum ist erfüllt von seinem Schreien.

column2: You take a scalpel and look upon your victim's hamstrings and muscles. This time you were not so lucky. This is the body of a weak and skinny person, from which you cannot get much material but working on it will bring no less pleasure! Well, let's get to work! You stab the scalpel into your victim's flesh, and their screams start to fill the room.
column4: Ihr nehmt das Skalpell auf und betrachtest die Sehnen und Muskeln des Opfers. Dieses Mal habt Ihr nicht so viel Glück. Dieser Körper ist eher schwach und wenig davon kann verwendet werden... aber damit zu arbeiten wird nicht weniger Freude bringen! Auf ans Werk! Ihr stecht mit dem Skalpell ins Fleisch Eures Opfers und der Raum ist erfüllt von seinem Schreien.

column2:
Lich King's favour to you, [Root.GetSocietyRank] [Root.GetFirstName].

These mortals think that they have the right to judge us, but they have not seen even half of the potential of our dark magic! However, necromancy requires sacrifice, and now is the time to find another mortal for our experiments.

Glory to the Lich King!
Signed, [From.GetSocietyRank] [From.GetFirstName]
column4:
Die Gunst des Lichkönigs sei mit Euch, [Root.GetSocietyRank] [Root.GetFirstName],

diese Sterblichen denken, dass sie das Recht haben, uns zu verurteilen. Sie haben nicht einmal ansatzweise die wahre Macht unserer dunklen Magie gesehen! Trotz allem erfordert Nekromantie Opfer und jetzt ist es an der Zeit, einen anderen Sterblichen für unsere Experimente zu finden.

Ehre sei dem Lichkönig!
[From.GetSocietyRank] [From.GetFirstName]

column2:
Lich King's favour to you, [Root.GetSocietyRank] [Root.GetFirstName].

The cult requires more loyal servants. Turn [target_future_undead.GetTitledFirstName] to one of the undead and make [target_future_undead.GetHerHim] your loyal servant - willing or not.

Glory to the Lich King!
Signed, [From.GetSocietyRank] [From.GetFirstName]
column4:
Die Gunst des Lichkönigs sei mit Euch, [Root.GetSocietyRank] [Root.GetFirstName],

unser Kult benötigt neue Diener und [target_future_undead.GetTitledFirstName] wäre eine gute Wahl. Verwandelt [target_future_undead.GetHerHim] in [target_future_undead.Geteineneine] [target_future_undead.GetUntoteUntoten] und macht [target_future_undead.Getihnsie] zu Eurem treuen Diener - egal ob [target_future_undead.Getersie] will oder nicht.

Ehre sei dem Lichkönig!
[From.GetSocietyRank] [From.GetFirstName]

column2: Your servants have found a strange, green, pulsating crystal in your quarters. It emits a very powerful dark energy, but despite this, it might be worth harnessing...
column4: Eure Diener haben einen seltsamen, grünen, pulsierenden Kristall in Eurem Reich gefunden. Es strahlt eine mächtige, dunkle Energie aus, aber trotzdem... Diese Energie... Sie könnte gezähmt werden...

column2: Use its power!
column4: Nutzen wir seine Macht!

column2: Destroy it!
column4: Zerstört ihn!

column2: Your clan is drawn from a group of slaves, but the determination and steadfastedness of your ancestors granted them freedom. According to tradition, you must prove your loyalty to the ideals of the clan by cutting off one of your hands, just as your ancestors did in order to cast off their chains.
column4: Euer Clan stammt von einer Gruppe Sklaven ab, aber die Entschlossenheit und Standhaftigkeit gab euren Vorfahren ihre Freiheit. Gemäß der Tradition müssen Ihr Eure Selbstlosigkeit und Loyalität gegenüber den Idealen des Clans beweisen und eine Eurer Hände opfern, genau wie es Eure Vorfahren getan haben, um die Ketten der Sklaverei abzuwerfen.

column2: For the ancestors!
column4: Für die Vorfahren!

column2: I can't
column4: Ich kann nicht...

column2: According to traditions within your clan, each Bleeding Hollow chieftain undertakes a shamanic vision quest upon ascension to leadership of the clan, a quest on which they sacrificed one of their own eyes to receive a vision of their future death - but sometimes the vision would show much more.
column4: Gemäß den Traditionen Eures Clans, opfert jeder neue Anführer des Clans des blutigen Auges nach dem Tod seines Vorgängers eines seiner Augen, um eine Vision seines eigenen Todes zu empfangen. Aber manchmal zeigt die Vision ein wenig mehr...

column2: Show me!
column4: Lasst mich sehen!

column2: §Y[Root.GetTitledName]§! sees [Root.GetHerHis] future death.\n
column4: §Y[Root.GetTitledName]§! sieht [Root.GetIhrenSeinen] zukünftigen Tod.\n

column2: You see the last moments of your life. You die at the zenith of glory, surrounded by your faithful soldiers. You made the clan great and left this world with dignity. There is no doubt that you will have a great future.
column4: Ihr seht die letzten Momente Eures Lebens vor Eurem inneren Auge. Ihr seid auf dem Höhepunkt Eurer Macht gestorben, umgeben von Euren treuen Kriegern. Ihr habt den Clan zu wahrer Größe geführt und diese Welt würdig verlassen. Ohne Zweifel steht Euch eine großartige Zukunft bevor.

column2: Truly a glorious death!
column4: Truly a glorious death!

column2: You see the last moments of your life. You died dishonourably, brought low by the blow of a dagger. This vision frightens you - who would assassinate you? You will have a life full of fear and doubts about your destiny.
column4: You see the last moments of your life. You died dishonourably, brought low by the blow of a dagger. This vision frightens you - who would assassinate you? You will have a life full of fear and doubts about your destiny.

column2: So that's how it will be...
column4: So that's how it will be...

column2: You see the last moments of your life. You die in the heat of battle, taking many enemies with you as you let loose one last powerful roar that echoes through the forest. There is no doubt that you will have a life full of blood-fury and battles.
column4: You see the last moments of your life. You die in the heat of battle, taking many enemies with you as you let loose one last powerful roar that echoes through the forest. There is no doubt that you will have a life full of blood-fury and battles.

column2: The prisoner you chose is prepared for the transformation. Wielding daggers, your acolytes commit ritual murder to carry out the process. [From.GetSheHeCap] almost left this world, but you brought [From.GetHerHis] soul back using dark magic.
column4: The prisoner you chose is prepared for the transformation. Wielding daggers, your acolytes commit ritual murder to carry out the process. [From.GetSheHeCap] almost left this world, but you brought [From.GetHerHis] soul back using dark magic.

column2: Turn into an undead.
column4: Turn into an undead.

column2: I'll bind the spirit of [From.GetHerHim]. An extra pair of eyes is always welcome.
column4: I'll bind the spirit of [From.GetHerHim]. An extra pair of eyes is always welcome.

column2: Recently, the harmful influence of Fel magic has changed something in you. You feel its presence in every vein, at every fingertip. It changes you irrevocably, perverting your mind and revealing its darkest corners.
column4: Recently, the harmful influence of Fel magic has changed something in you. You feel its presence in every vein, at every fingertip. It changes you irrevocably, perverting your mind and revealing its darkest corners.

column2: You feel the Fel magic consuming your body. Your soul, like that of any demon, is now tied to the Twisting Nether. You have nothing to lose - you are no longer mortal, and the shell of your body is no longer important to your survival.
column4: You feel the Fel magic consuming your body. Your soul, like that of any demon, is now tied to the Twisting Nether. You have nothing to lose - you are no longer mortal, and the shell of your body is no longer important to your survival.

column2: I'm invincible!
column4: I'm invincible!

column2: The harmful influence of Fel magic begins to diminish, but you still feel the traces of its sinister magic within you. All those changes, all those wounds that it caused, will remain with you and your descendants forever, as punishment for past sins.
column4: The harmful influence of Fel magic begins to diminish, but you still feel the traces of its sinister magic within you. All those changes, all those wounds that it caused, will remain with you and your descendants forever, as punishment for past sins.

column2: There has been too much flow of Fel magic into your body lately, filling your tissues and bones with its corrupting influence like an empty vessel. If you do not isolate yourself, its corrupting presence will continue to grow.
column4: There has been too much flow of Fel magic into your body lately, filling your tissues and bones with its corrupting influence like an empty vessel. If you do not isolate yourself, its corrupting presence will continue to grow.

column2: You are no longer meddling with the dangerous magic of Fel. It gradually leaves your body, freeing you from its harmful influence and leaving only painful reminder and wounds behind.
column4: You are no longer meddling with the dangerous magic of Fel. It gradually leaves your body, freeing you from its harmful influence and leaving only painful reminder and wounds behind.

column2: Your scouts found a well of strange energy in the forest. They say that it emits very dark, but powerful magic. Its green water will give power to the one who will drinks from it, but doing so might negatively affect mind and body.
column4: Your scouts found a well of strange energy in the forest. They say that it emits very dark, but powerful magic. Its green water will give power to the one who will drinks from it, but doing so might negatively affect mind and body.

column2: I'll take this power for myself.
I'll share this power with my people.
All your vassals and courtiers receive an offer to drink the green liquid.\n
Bury the well and forget about this place.

Your suzerain, [From.GetTitledFirstName], invites you to drink some strange green liquid. Some say that it emits very dark but powerful magic. Its green waters will give power to the one who drinks of them, but may also bear significant detrimental affects upon your mind.
I accept this offer.
It's best that I refuse.

Dark energy has poisoned the lands of [From.GetName]. The soil is painted gray, and a thick fog shrouds the lands. It can easily disorientate anyone who stays in it... and they may never return home alive.
Your past gods turned their back on you after the Fel magic corrupted you. Poisoning your soul, awakening your cruelty and craving for violence, it slowly defiles you from within.
There is another way.
I will do anything to quench my thirst.

Dark energy has burnt out the lands of [From.GetName]. The terrain of this province turns to red desert, devoid of any sign of life, whilst streams of dark magic permeate the skin and bones of any traveler that dares to stray here.

Fel energy has left unrecoverable scars in the province of [From.GetName]. In this area, the line between the Twisting Nether and the real world has faded. Through the tainted gaps, a colossal amount of Fel magic bleeds into Azeroth.
The land of the province of [From.GetName] is beginning to recover from its wounds, and is no longer under the harmful influence of dark energy.
The land of the province of [From.GetName] has recovered from its wounds, and is no longer under the harmful influence of dark energy.
The Voice in Your Head

Recently, you have begun to hear a malevolent voice in your head. This creature from another world, as it refers to itself, asks you to speak with it and carry out a mysterious ritual on its behalf. Perhaps you should actually make a deal with this creature. The mental connection alone is enough to fill you with power from this strange entity.
I should shield my mind from this dark creature's influence.
Stops the event chain.\n
I just need to tough it out.
A ritual? That's an interesting idea
You try to make contact with the creature.\n

You have prepared for the ritual. You throw a strange green powder into the fire, which starts to sparkle green. In the flames you see a silhouette, enveloped in an aura of Fel magic. You have a talk with a powerful creature that you are sure is from the Twisting Nether, and it wants you to let it into Azeroth. But is that a good idea?
I dont want to make pacts with demons!
Sounds interesting... but what will I get in return?
You try to make a better deal with the demon.\n
This is a very tempting offer...
You make a deal with the demon.\n

To create a short-term tear between Azeroth and the Twisting Nether, you need to sacrifice another one's life. Fortunately, within your court there is a good candidate - [target_victim_for_ritual.GetTitledFirstName]. No one will notice [From.GetHerHis] disappearance.
Not a great loss.
You continue with the preparations for the ritual.\n
What was I thinking! I must put an end to this at once.

You are ready for the next ritual. By sacrificing someone's life, you managed to create a tear between Azeroth and the Twisting Nether. Reality was briefly distorted, and you saw the figure of a two-legged creature with wings. It stood upright and leaped upon you and - a few moments later - it firmly gripped your neck. ''Now I shall take your place in this world, worm!''

You are ready for the next ritual. By sacrificing someone's life, you managed to create a gap between Azeroth and the Twisting Nether. Reality was briefly distorted and you saw the figure of a huge four-footed creature, but it was not alone: a small detachment of demons came into this world. The creature straightened up and stormed towards you. A few moments later its giant hammer hung over you. ''Fool, now we will walk the flaming tread on this world!''

You are ready for the next ritual. By sacrificing someone's life, you managed to create a tear between Azeroth and the Twisting Nether. Reality is briefly distorted, and you saw the figure of a giant levitating creature with one glaring eye. A few moments later, it materialized near you and its eye became wreathed in green flame. ''I do not need you anymore, mortal!''.

You are ready for the next ritual. By sacrificing someone's life, you managed to create a tear between Azeroth and the Twisting Nether. Reality was briefly distorted, and you saw the figure of a large demon. It straightened up and offered you a gift in gratitude for your help before disappearing.

You are ready for the next ritual. By sacrificing someone's life, you managed to create a tear between Azeroth and the Twisting Nether. Reality was briefly distorted, and you saw the figure of a large demon. It straightened up and offered you the previously agreed upon gift as well as its loyalty in gratitude for your help.
Nooooo!
§Y[target_summoned_demon.GetTitledFirstName]§! remains at your court.\n

[Root.PrimaryTitle.GetFOA], I wish to serve you and would happily obey any order you give. I hope that you will allow me to become one of your loyal vassals.

Signed,
[From.GetTitledName]
No, I can use one of the soul shards.
The Invasion of the Burning Legion

The world of Azeroth is threatened once again. Demons of the Burning Legion have found a way into your world. With the great magic of [From.GetTitledFirstName] and powerful artifacts, the border between Azeroth and the Twisting Nether has been erased. Hundreds of demons surge into your world through portals. The Burning Crusade has begun. The destiny of Azeroth hangs in the balance.
Azeroth will fall!
The Burning Legion must be stopped!
The Defeat of the Burning Legion

The armies of the Burning Legion have been defeated! Only a handful of demons attempts to continue the war effort in Azeroth, but they are nothing compared to our superior armies. The leader of the invasion, [Root.GetTitledFirstName] has been banished, and it is unlikely that he will lead a new invasion. Thankfully, it is unlikely that the armies of demons of the Burning Legion will attempt to take over our world again in the near future.
After many trials and tribulations, Azeroth has been saved!
The Burning Legion will return...
Has access to a powerful source of magic\n
Has a powerful magical artifact\n

The expedition of the Horde passed through the shroud of the Dark Portal and is ready to gain a foothold in this new wild world. Our once beautiful world now resembles an immense wasteland. Without food. Without water. Without life. Nevertheless, here you can still survive...\nHere, among the red sands, there stands the Hellfire Citadel, our very first bastion in the world of Azeroth. Now it belongs to the orcs of Ner'zhul, and the sorcerer himself tries to open portals to other worlds.\nThe main attack on the fortress seems insane to many. The elders propose to take a small fortress near the portal and acquire a fleet to strike at the enemy from the flanks. This can ease the battle to come in the future.
Loktar Ogar! Call the grunts!
Why do we need this cursed peace, when we have the whole of Azeroth in our hands?
The orcs have built this citadel out of stone and steel. It is very unlikely we will take such a structure with ease.
What? Are you cowards?! LOK'TAR OGAR!

In the area known as 'Gorgrond', a forested region with large spikey outcroppings, overgrown wildthorns, and brutish creatures, we have discovered a strange people: a group of orcs known as the Laughing Skull Clan. The most distinguishing trait of these people is their tendency to laugh, riding on chitin-shelled wasps and oversized insects. They are fond of a type of mask that they wear, which is made from chitin or bone. It seems as though that they may become good allies - if we are to ignore past indiscretions. Their leader, an ogre by the name of Mogor, is willing to help us as a gesture of goodwill. Should we accept their help? The Laughing Skulls are rather unsavory... can we really ally them?
Wonderful! Let's discuss working together!
Let them assist us at the Dark Portal! If they will act like honest allies, they will be granted a domain from our leader!
What!? Kill them all and take the book by force! Lok'tar Ogar!

The Laughing Skull clan and their unhinged leader have agreed to help us. Their way of fighting is truly frightening. Even in their small numbers, the warriors of their clan are more dangerous than any of our soldiers. It is worth celebrating that these insane orcs are on our side.

The Laughing Skull clan and their unhinged leader have agreed to help us. Even though they drank the demon's blood, they cry havoc for war! It was decided that it would be wise to leave them at the Dark Portal, promising them land in the future. They will be able to hold off rival orcish clans that reside near the portal.

Information was received about the appearance of Deathwing on Draenor. Apparently, he has rewoven his alliance with some members of the Horde, and even taken possession of the skull of Gul'dan, which is a powerful demonic artifact! The great beast overcame the fortifications of the Horde and flew towards the Blade's Edge Mountains, where he most likely decided to wait out the heat of the upcoming battles.\nPart of the expedition will go after the Aspect of Death, and bring him to justice for his crimes. The main forces of the Horde will focus on the traitors. The bountiful forests of Terokkar lie ahead of us, the edge of the woods already visible. Our leader's people will be able to find allies there for further offensives against the Black Temple, the main stronghold of Ner'zhul's army.

Though it took some time, we managed to locate Deathwing and his despicable brood. The dragon disappeared slightly to the north of the lands possessed by the Laughing Skull, among the peaks of the Blade's Edge mountains. The mountains are also inhabited by the gronn: huge semi-intelligent creatures, distant relatives of ogres.\nGruul, the lord of the gronns, saw how we fought with the creations of the mad aspect, and is ready to help us in the battle with Deathwing. But can we trust the ogre offspring?
What nonsense! The enemy of my enemy is my friend - even if they are not green.
The gronn? We have forcefully dealt with them in the past!

On the way to the Black Temple, our soldiers marched into the forests of Terokkar, one of the few places on Draenor which has largely avoided the destruction wrought by fel magic. This land is home to the clan of gordunni, one of the few ogre families who maintained their sanity after the desecration of Draenor. They still follow the traditions of the Gorian Empire and keep to themselves.\nIn The nearby forests also are home to the mysterious arakkoa, as well as groups of the Shattered Hand clan. They practice dark magic and offer sacrifices to the gods, like the Loa. Nevertheless, some of them are in contact with other races.\nMaybe one of them will agree to help us in the upcoming battle?
The gordunni clan is deemed to be worthy of preservation. Shall we give them a chance?
Arakkoa you say? These people can get along with our troll friends!
The Horde already has too many mouths to feed!

Ner'zhul is still ahead of us! But we are ready to give battle to this treacherous sorcerer! The Horde is already at the gates of the Black Temple. The only issue is that after we attack, we might lose our path home. A powerful armada of traitors will soon launch a massive attack on our positions at the Dark Portal, cutting us off.

Draenor is dying, and there's nothing we can do about it. Ner'zhul's portals broke through the fabric of reality, and now the whole world is at risk of being destroyed. We do not know what will happen to Draenor in the near future, but many elders say that it is doomed, and it is important to protect our new home from the coming threat.
We have to destroy the Portal!
Is it worth it to close the Dark Portal? Ner'zhul has fled, and we have won the war!
Well, let's do it!

When you drew near while holding the magic stone in your hand, [From.GetDynName] started turning pale. [From.GetHerHisCap] life force was slowly shifting into the stone, which begun to glow brighter and brighter. When you finished your spell, [From.GetFirstName] no longer showed any signs of life. Now [From.GetHerHis] broken and imprisoned soul appears as a shimmering violet color imprisoned within the core of the stone.

You have completed all preparations for the upcoming summoning ritual. Soulstones and your magic should help break through the fabric between the two realities, and help subdue the will of some lower demon. And if everything turns out well, it will become your faithful servant. But which demon do you want to call?
Mischievous imp.
Lustful succubus.
Ugly felhunter.
Loyal felguard.
Join the Brotherhood of the Horse
Join the Order of the Silver Hand
Demand Death Knights
You demand that §Y[Root.GetTitledName]§! creates a death knight for your retinue.
Create Death Knight
You create a death knight for your court.
Create the Horde
Join the Horde
Leave the Horde
Create the Alliance
Join the Alliance
Leave the Alliance
Invite to the Horde
You invite §Y[Root.GetTitledName]§! to your faction.
Invite to the Alliance
You invite §Y[Root.GetTitledName]§! to your faction.
You send a request to join the faction, but you will not be able to join another for some time.
You send a request to join the faction, but you will not be able to join another for some time.
You create the Horde and have the opportunity to seek new allies.
You leave the faction, losing the protection and assistance of your former allies.
You leave the faction, losing the protection and assistance of your former allies.
You create the Alliance and have the opportunity to seek new allies.
Betray Faction
You betray your faction and align yourself with its enemies.
Expel
You expel the character from your state. If they had any titles, all their land titles will be passed to you.
Challenge to Mak'gora
You challenge §Y[Root.GetTitledName]§! to a Mak'gora, a ''duel of honour'' in orcish. Refusing the Mak'gora is a disgrace among the orcs.
Challenge for Supremacy
You challenge §Y[Root.GetTitledName]§ for supremacy! Should you be victorious, some of [Root.GetHisHer] titles will pass to you.
Find the Tomb of Sargeras
You sail out onto the sea in search of the Tomb of Sargeras, the mighty fallen titan. What is hidden in the tomb will almost certainly give you unprecedented power.
Begin to openly practice dark magic
You openly declare yourself a disciple of dark magic and you lose the false classes.
Disembowel
You kill the character in the name of §Y[Root.GetTitledFirstName]§! and get the flesh you need.
Turn Undead
You kill the character in the name of §Y[Root.GetTitledFirstName]§! and resurrect [Root.GetHerHim] as a faithful corpse.
Founding the Cult of the Damned
You create a secret society called the Cult of the Damned and become its head.
Create the Plague
Create the plague, a most dangerous disease that inevitably kills the infected before raising it as an undead, and begin to experiment with it on the inhabitants of Northrend.
Humans become susceptible to the Plague\n
Spread the Plague to Lordaeron
Using the powers of the Cult of the Damned, you begin to spread the plague into Lordaeron through infected grain.
Centralise Faction
Centralize your faction and form a single state headed by you. All members of your faction become your vassals.
All members of your faction should have at least an opinion of §G25§! about you\n
Your faction must have at least 5 kingdoms or more (aside from your own)\n
Build the Wall
The isolation of Gilneas from Lordaeron is a necessity. You are building a huge wall between Gilneas and Lordaeron.
Infect Grain
Infect the harvested grain within the storage facilities of the town.
Recruit to the Cult of the Damned
Attempt to find out whether §Y[Root.GetTitledFirstName]§! is open to the power of the occult. If so, you may invite [Root.GetHerHim] to become a member of the Cult of the Damned.
Eliminate Population
Eliminate the population of §Y[Root.Location.GetName]§! and convert the province to your religion and culture. The local population will be very angry.
Culling
Rid the province of §Y[Root.Location.GetName]§! of its dead inhabitants.
Bring Death
Bring death to the population of §Y[Root.Location.GetName]§! and give them eternal life.
There has not been such a feast within the last two years.
Hold the Noblegarden Festival
Hold the Lunar Festival
Hold the Love is in the Air Festival
Hold the Children's Week Festival
Hold the Midsummer Fire Festival
Hold the Harvest Festival
Hold Brewfest
Hold the Hallows End Festival

The great festival of Noblegarden has long been celebrated by humans, and more recently by the other races of the Alliance. During this joyous event, it is customary for the nobles and lords from each race to hide coins, candy, and the occasional treasures within special eggs painted to look like wildflowers. These eggs are then scattered around major cities for the citizenry to find.

Every year, the druids of Moonglade hold a celebration of their city's great triumph over an ancient evil. During the Lunar Festival, citizens of Azeroth have the opportunity to honour their elders by celebrating their sage wisdom, sharing in magnificent feasts, and of course by shooting fireworks!

Love may be in the air, but be cautious, as the seasons spreading joy seems to have nefarious undertones. Recently, a strange ''love sickness'' has clouded the hearts of many of Azeroths people - is this widespread incident simply an outbreak of romance, or will you and your fellow brave adventurers uncover a dark secret behind this plague of passion?
Take an orphan under your wing, perform the tasks you are presented with, and youll show one of Azeroths children that you care!

Across Azeroth and Outland, brilliant bonfires have been lit to rekindle people's spirits and ward off ancient evils. Each year, new guardians are chosen to watch over the sacred flames and ensure that they are never extinguished. Called ''flamekeepers,'' these chosen few request the aid of brave adventurers to traverse the land and journey into the dark recesses of Azeroth's dungeons. It is rumoured that any heroes who are willing to brave the terrors placed before them will be rewarded for their efforts through the power of the flames.

The Harvest Festival is a time to commemorate those who have sacrificed their lives to help their allies. Throughout history, many have given their lives to that end. Every year, members of the Horde and the Alliance set aside time to honour the memories of the fallen and to pay tribute to those whose memories are held most dear: Uther Lightbringer for the Alliance, and Grommash Hellscream for the Horde.

Celebrated by both the Horde and the Alliance, Brewfest is a time to enjoy the fermented fruits of the harvest: pretzels, cheese, and booze! The competing breweries of Thunderbrew, Barleybrew, and the ogre brewers all come together outside of the major cities in a bid to outdo each other with their special ales, meads, and beers. Brave adventurers are invited to sit back, take a break, and sample the finest wares these brewers have to offer!

Observed by both the Horde and the Alliance, Hallow's End is a celebration of the break between the Forsaken and the Scourge. Many tricks and treats await adventurers seeking holiday fun, including defeating the Headless Horseman, visiting inns and cities for fun items such as masks and costumes, and eating way too much candy in one sitting.

It's a time to reflect on your journeys and good fortune by sharing plentiful food and stories with friends. You can partake in wonderful Pilgrim's Bounty feasts near major towns by sitting at a bountiful table and enjoying the foods you find.

The Festival of Winter Veil is one of the most anticipated events of the year! While enjoying a freshly nutmegged cup of nog and crunching on a crumbly cookie or two, be sure to visit Greatfather Winter in Ironforge if youre a member of the Alliance, or Greatfather Winter in Orgrimmar if youre part of the Horde. While there, youll find a few treats and a few tasks to take on as well.

Opening of the Dark Portal

The people of Stormwind lived in peace and prosperity on the continent of Azeroth for many years. Now Stormwind is facing a new deadly danger in the Black Morass. A gate has opened to another world - Draenor. This world of wild savagery - the home to orcs, ogres, and many other creatures - is dying. Orcs under the rule of demons and the Shadows Council have been slowly perverted and distorted by the Fel magic affecting all of the races inhabiting Draenor. Their world can no longer support the large population of orcs. Driven by the desire to find a new home and a thirst for blood, many orcs, led by the leaders of the clans and a single head of the Horde, seek to go through the Dark Portal. Now, clans of orcs and ogres erect fortifications in the Black Morass and are preparing to take the first steps as conquerors on Azeroth in search of their destiny.

The kingdom of Stormwind is one of the seven kingdoms of men. Its inhabitants always differed from the rest of mankind in their perseverance and iron will. Their king Llane Wrynn has ruled his people in peace and prosperity for eighteen years already. Even during the last century, Stormwind experienced two major wars: the war with the gnolls and the war with the gurubashi trolls, but it was able to withstand its enemies and strengthen its positions in the south of Azeroth. But a fateful confluence of circumstances may lead Stormwind to the largest and most destructive war it has ever faced, which will leave a once-powerful kingdom in ruins.

Blackhand the ''Destroyer'', the leader of the Blackrock clan - the largest clan - and one of the most famous warriors and generals. After spreading the Fel among the orcs, he and his brothers fought against the draenei, with the help of the Shadow Council and Gul'dan himself. At the head of the Horde, he became the puppet of the council as a result of his greed and shortsightedness. Despite this, Blackhand led the orcs to victory against the draenei, leading an army from Hellfire Citadel. Draenor was conquered by the Horde, though the damage was already done. With the corruption of Draenor growing, Gul'dan found a new world to conquer: Azeroth. It was Blackhand who led troops through the Dark Portal to invade Azeroth, though death would come for him not long after.

Upon the death of High King Modimus Anvilmar, the fierce tensions that permeated the Ironforge boiled over. War subsequently broke out between the three rival clans and all of Ironforge's resources were mobilised in support of one clan or another. Bloody and destructive, the war raged on for many years before the Bronzebeard clan, the most numerous and martial of the three, successfully drove the other two from the city, claiming it for themselves. Bitter from their defeat, the Wildhammer and Dark Iron clans left the region and established their own states nearby. Although a period of relative peace ensued, it proved to be short-lived. Unable to come to terms with his clan's defeat, sorcerer-thane Thaurissan now prepares his Dark Iron dwarves to launch a massive, two-pronged invasion of the other two clans' respective territories, seeking vengeance for their previous defeat.

To complete this mission, §Gright-click§! on the portrait of §Y[FromFrom.GetTitledFirstName]§!, select §Y'Mind control'§! and successfully enthrall [FromFrom.GetHerHim].
The Will of the Legion

Minutes of existence in this piece of ice last for eternity, though only seven days ago you were the greatest shaman of your people. But now you have been turned to disembodied lichdom, bound in the eternal ice of Icecrown. This is the punishment of the Burning Legion for your impudence. You have retained freedom of action, but the council of the Nathrezim has been assigned to watch over you, following your every step, a puppet. The Dreadlords conveyed to you the will of their master: call the Legion to Azeroth, no matter the cost! If you disobey, the demons will easily destroy your soul, without leaving a grain of the former Ner'zhul behind. We'll have to obey... for now.
Be damned, demons!

The path of the shadow priest is a path steeped in the Void and dark magic, one of the fundamental forces in our universe. The Void is the home of terrifying monstrosities, and only the strongest of spirits can preserve their mind and life after being exposed to it. Shadow priests have a varied and very dangerous set of skills: they can distort the mind and body of living beings, causing pain and insanity. Despite all of this, if you adhere to the balance between dark and light, you might control this dangerous magic for the benefit of yourself and others.
You have completed your training on the path of the shadow priest. Now it is up to you to decide what to do with your newfound powers of the Void.
A shadow priest

Your previous gods turned their back on you after you embraced the Void. The emptiness slowly fills your soul, displacing your previously earnest and righteous disposition with a far more sinister and callous one.
No! Everything must be in balance!
I saw the true face of the abyss!
Learning Shadow Magic
Learning Shadow Magic
the Ashbringer
the Adamant
the Old Murk-Eye
the Whacked
the Lightbringer
the Spiritbinder
the Darkener
the Divine
Learn Shadow Magic by yourself
Learn Shadow Magic and become a shadow priest.
the Australian
Starts training\n
I'm free!
No! I'll stay loyal!
Raise [From.GetHerHim] as a death knight.
§Y[This.GetBestName]§! becomes a death knight\n
Your allies capture all the counties they claim or have captured, if they made a significant contribution to the war.\n
Genocide
The population of this province is actively being exterminated.
Culling
The undead in this province are actively being exterminated.
Spreading of Death
The living population of this province is actively being turned into shambling corpses.

Draenor continues to die slowly. Now none of the orcs have a desire to remain on a perishing world. Those who were left on Draenor are now hungry, sick and insane... but have crossed the line between the worlds. Among them are the most bloodthirsty bands of orcs, who inspire fear and respect in other, less virulent clans. The clans of the Burning Blade and the Dragonmaw will overwhelm anyone who stands in the way of the Horde.

Past wars took the lives of many bloodthirsty warriors and warlocks, who would be very useful now. Fortunately, you came across texts on the ancient art of necromancy, which allows you to return the dead to life or something like that. These lifeless warriors will not feel pain nor fear, and their thirst for death can be compared only with natural demonic cruelty.
We must send our servants to collect bodies for future rituals.
We don't need walking corpses!

Today one of your Nathrezim masters appeared before you, [target_dreadlord.GetTitledFirstName]. He has urged you to continue your summoning of the Burning Legion, and asked you to expedite the execution of your plans. ''You must find the source of power required for the portal as soon as possible. My lord does not wish to delay our fateful hour any longer'' he said, and then vanished as suddenly as he had appeared.

One of your Nathrezim masters, named [target_dreadlord.GetTitledFirstName], has once again appeared before you. [target_dreadlord.GetSheHeCap] was quite calm and reserved, but [target_dreadlord.GetHerHis] eyes were burning with fury. [target_dreadlord.GetSheHeCap] remained silent for several minutes before breaking the tension and uttered [target_dreadlord.GetHerHis] warning in a melodic voice. ''If you do not fulfill your destiny, [Root.GetFirstName], then I promise you that you will spend all eternity in suffering locked in this armor!'' After the threat was delivered, the messenger vanished.\nThe Legion's patience is at its end. If you do not wish to be subjected to the wrath of the Legion, you must fulfil their will.

All your Nathrezim masters have come to you. They were furious, eyes alight with fire. ''You let us down, [Root.GetFirstName]!'' As [target_dreadlord.GetTitledFirstName] finished speaking, you felt a terrible agony in your soul. If you had been alive, you would have quickly lost consciousness from the pain and would cease to be tormented - but alas, you are not, and will be eternally damned. ''And what's worse... you lied to the Legion!''

One of your Nathrezim masters has come to you. ''[Root.GetFirstName], I believe we are not familiar with one another. My name is [target_dreadlord.GetTitledFirstName], and I am to keep watch so that you do not carry out anymore nonsense, and to ensure that you fulfil your destiny. You must aid in bringing the Burning Legion to this world, and if you don't, my brothers and me will do everything to turn your life into a hell.'' After a brief pause [target_dreadlord.GetSheHe] added, ''I hope we understood each other.'' After speaking, [target_dreadlord.GetTitledFirstName] disappeared.
Damned demons!
My jailor
Dreadlord's Visit
The Chains are Broken

You have done extraordinarily well. All of your former Nathrezim masters are dead, incapacitated, or in captivity. The Burning Legion can no longer control you through the power of the Dreadlords, and you are no longer required to do the will of the Legion. Now no one will prevent the Scourge from fulfiling its true potential.
Go back to the Nether, demons!
You are no longer a pawn of the Legion!\n
The Legion and the Scourge

You have completed your assignment. The Legion has begun its burning crusade for Azeroth, but still needs your support. Your undead army can have a major impact on the course of the invasion. If we decide to help the Legion, the mortals will have almost no chance. However, if we decide to betray the Legion, the demons will be dealt with swiftly.
I'm loyal to the Legion!

[From.GetTitledFirstName] obeyed our will and will support our cause in the war against the puny mortals of Azeroth. There is no doubt that the people of Azeroth will fall, and we will destroy this cursed planet!

Damn you, [From.GetFirstName]! [From.GetTitledFirstName] betrayed us. We will destroy the Scourge along with all the races of Azeroth who dare resist the will of the Legion. We will destroy this planet!
The Fate

In recent months, much has happened: the mystical Plague, rumors of the dark cult of necromancers. You finally have a quiet evening to think about everything in retrospect. You feel something... odd. That something ominous is happening and that you are at the center of these events. In this dark hour of Azeroth, your actions could change the course of history, and to save your vassals and citizens from all of the trials and tribulations that await them. You will be unstoppable, and something in your head tells you that some courses of action may not be as righteous as they seem.
I will save my people.

The nightmare continues. The city is disgraced with burned buildings, piles of corpses, and the smell of decaying flesh that lingers from your deceased brothers and sisters. When the plague was in its infancy, you could not imagine it would be this bad. The Scourge is growing and growing with every one of your people that falls. You cannot imagine a worse way to die.
What have they done to my people?

The people who have become infected with the plague cannot be saved. Only pain and suffering await them. Once they die they will become Scourge, and each might take another ten good men with them. If we do not stop this, it will not be long before we all succumb! The only way out is to save the infected from suffering. We must kill them all!
I will save them from their suffering!
I'm not a butcher!
The Culling of [From.GetName]

Terrible news have has reached your court. The Scourge drives people to carry out atrocious acts... [Root.GetTitledFirstName] and [Root.GetHerHis] army has killed all of the infected residents of [From.GetName]. Among the infected people were men, women and children, but [Root.GetFirstName] showed no mercy. After the butchering, [Root.GetSheHe] set the city on fire and left it in ruins.
I cant believe it!
It was the only way out.

The Dreadlord [target_dreadlord.GetTitledFirstName], who was involved with the plague of the Scourge in your kingdom, fled to Northrend. There's no doubt that the the Scourge came from there. If you strike at the heart of the Scourge, then you might save your people. Upon returning from this campaign, you will be greeted as a hero!
I will be unshakable!
My people need me here.

The cold winds of Northrend assail your face without remorse. There is a strong smell of death and rot lingering in the air, but the scent settled in many decades ago. Somewhere among these frozen wastes, one of the architects of the Scourge hides, [target_dreadlord.GetTitledFirstName]. His death would bring you great pleasure after all what the Scourge did to your people. You cannot stop until you find him, and you must seek vengeance for all that you had to endure... for all that you had to do.
Damn you, [target_dreadlord.GetTitledFirstName]!
The Potential Champion

A few days ago, the ships of a potential champion, [target_champion.GetTitledFirstName], anchored off the shores of the northern continent of Northrend. [target_champion.GetSheHe] is distinguished by [target_champion.GetHerHis] arrogance, aspiration, and ambition. You believe that [target_champion.GetSheHe] has all the qualities necessary to become your most loyal and powerful ally. Someday [target_champion.GetSheHe] will move to the dark side of the force. To achieve this, you have hidden a mighty runesword - Frostmourne - in one of the frozen caves of Northrend. If everything goes according to plan, then [target_champion.GetTitledFirstName] will certainly find it...
Curses upon Northrend! There was only death and pain! Now it's obvious it was a bad idea to sail there. But something... something yet calls upon me to go there. However, it doesn't matter anymore.

To your great regret, [target_champion.GetTitledFirstName] did not step in and left Northrend without getting caught by your tricks. There was a chance that [target_champion.GetSheHe] would be your ally, but alas. Your servants have given you Frostmourne. Since your plan failed, you will need this blade for other purposes.

Your [GetFromRelation] [From.GetFirstName] traveled to the lands of the cold Northrend along with an army of volunteers. Straight into the heart of the Scourge. Who knows what will happen to [target_champion.GetHerHim] there.
I have a feeling that this is not going to end well.
Your [GetFromRelation], [From.GetFirstName] changed his mind and hastily left the frozen and unforgiving wastelands of Northrend, avoiding all the dangers that awaited [target_champion.GetHerHim].

You have been wandering around the icy wastelands of Northrend for quite some time, smashing one undead army after another and destroying all its manifestations on this continent. Your troops are already beyond exhaustion and want to return home. They do not understand that if we do not win against the undead here, there will be nowhere to go back to. You must stop all attempts at desertion! At any cost! The ships on which you sailed must be burnt! Your army will have no choice but to fight here.
Sink the ships!
You don't have to do anything. Let these cowards run!

You are increasingly confronted with innumerable legions of undead. You destroy one undead and it is replaced by five more. Ordinary weapons are not enough, but you have heard about some powerful artifact, called Frostmourne. Its strength can reverse the course of the war and end the Scourge once and for all. The dead will be avenged!
So what are we waiting for?!

Your quest led you to an inconspicuous entrance to a cave. As soon as you went inside, you were struck by its size. It was a huge hall with icy walls. In the center was a small platform, upon which lies an altar with a treasured blade. Approaching the blade, you began to feel something dark in it. It is cursed, but there was no doubt in its power. It could change everything... it could save you and your people.
I will give anything, or pay any price, if only it will help me save my people.

The power of Frostmourne amazes and frightens simultaneously. You have easily dealt with all the obstacles set before you, and soon come across your most hated enemy. [target_dreadlord.GetTitledFirstName] appears before you. Here, at last, is the moment of sweet revenge. You do not hesitate to thrust the blade into the heart of the demon. But all the others are dead... now only you and the voice of the sword in your head are left.
Everything is over.

It's been a long time since the events of Northrend, but now you return home. As you dreamed, these fools meet you as a hero, but all this posturing is no longer important to you. The voice spoke about the true meaning. You are ready to sacrifice everything that you cherish. With these thoughts, you enter the throne room. Your [target_ruler.GetRootRelation], [target_ruler.GetTitledFirstName] rises from the throne and stretches out [target_ruler.GetHerHis] arms to embrace you, and at this time you uncover your blade.

It's been a long time since the events of Northrend, but now you return home. As you dreamed, these fools meet you as a hero, but all this posturing is no longer important to you. The voice spoke about true meaning. You are ready to sacrifice everything that you cherish. With these thoughts, you enter the throne room. [target_ruler.GetTitledFirstName] gets up from [target_ruler.GetHerHis] throne and prepares to greet you. And you at this time strip bare your blade.
You no longer need to bear the weight of your crown.
The Return from Northrend

Today is a solemn day, your [GetFromRelation], [target_champion.GetTitledFirstName] returned home after a successful campaign in Northrend. The people meet [target_champion.GetHerHis] as a hero and conqueror of the Scourge, and you are already prepared to meet [target_champion.GetHerHim] in the throne room. As [target_champion.GetSheHe] enters your hall, you get up from your throne, rising to embrace your returning champion. Suddenly [target_champion.GetSheHe] pulls [target_champion.GetHerHis] blade from [target_champion.GetHerHis] scabbard and rushes at you!

Today is a solemn day, [target_champion.GetTitledFirstName] returned home after a successful campaign in Northrend. The people meet [target_champion.GetHerHis] as a hero and conqueror of the Scourge, and you are already prepared to meet [target_champion.GetHerHis] in the throne room. As [target_champion.GetSheHe] appears in the entrance to your hall, you rise from your throne to greet them. Suddenly [target_champion.GetSheHe] pulls [target_champion.GetHerHis] blade from [target_champion.GetHerHis] scabbard and rushes at you!
What are you doing?!
The New Order

Terrible news have come to your hall. [Root.GetDynName], driven mad by a runeblade, killed the previous ruler [From.GetTitledFirstName] right in [From.GetHerHis] throne room and usurped power in the state. When the new [Root.GetTitle] was finished with the former monarch, [Root.GetSheHe] commited mass murder in the province of [Root.Capital.GetName]. Soldiers, men, women, children, guests of the capital, they all were killed. Their bodies lie in bloody piles in the streets. It was a nightmare brought to life, which only a few managed to survive.
It's horrible
From the ashes shall arise a new order!
You managed to avoid this fate.\n

It's been a long time since the events of Northrend, and now you have returned home. As you dreamed, these fools met you as a hero, but all this posturing is no longer important to you. The voice spoke of your true purpose. You are ready to sacrifice everything that you cherished. With these thoughts, you unleash the power of Frostmourne against your people. You no longer need these weak mortals - you will build a new order here.
I've taken care of everything.

Terrible news have arrived at your hall. [Root.GetTitledFirstName], driven mad by a runeblade, committed an act of mass murder in the province of [Root.Capital.GetName]. Soldiers, men, women, children, guests of the capital, they all were killed. Their bodies lie in bloody piles in the streets. It was a nightmare brought to life, which only a few managed to survive.
The Plague of Northrend

In the cold lands of the northern continent, Northrend, a strange illness has broken out. The heart of the infected first stops, and then starts to pump again. But it is no longer blood that flows through the veins. It's black and green lye, spread through the decaying body. Thus far, it affects only the people of Northrend, but who knows what will happen next and whether the plague can cross the sea...
The Plague of Lordaeron

In the heart of Lordaeron, a strange disease begins to spread. There are rumors that this is the same mysterious disease that struck people of Northrend. Those who are killed by this disease return to life, imprisoned in their rotting bodies. If these rumours prove true, the human kingdoms must oppose its spread with all their might.
Death is coming
Fools!
After you renounced the Light, you are no longer able to carry its blessings to the far corners of Azeroth. Now that its life-giving forces have left you, you are left alone to fend for yourself.
I don't regret it.

The fetid smell of rotting flesh has long surrounded you. Looking at one of your limbs, you realize that the rotting has already dried your flesh and dissolved the bones. If you do not want to turn into a shapeless bunch of decaying meat, then you need to find a replacement.

The dark magic that surrounds your cold, bony body is already starting to wane and barely holds the decrepit, worn knuckles together. If you do not want you to turn into bone powder, then you need to find a replacement.

Another hour passes while [target_physician.GetFirstName] tries to return your body to an acceptable state. Soon, [target_physician.GetSheHe] puts threads and a set of metal clips on the wooden surgical table, smiling as [target_physician.GetSheHe] announces ''Done!'' You examine the new part of the body. The operation is done fairly neatly, and your newly acquired flesh will last you a long time.

Another hour passes while [target_physician.GetFirstName] tries to return your body to an acceptable state. Soon, [target_physician.GetSheHe] puts threads and a set of metal clips on the wooden surgical table and announces with a smile ''Done!'' You examine the new part of your body - the operation is not done well enough, as you new body part is flawed, but it seems like it will last you some time...

Another hour passes while [target_physician.GetFirstName] tries to return your body to an acceptable state. Soon, [target_physician.GetSheHe] puts threads and a set of metal clips on the improvised surgical table, and madly cackles ''Done!'' You examine the new part of your body - and what you see stuns you. Perhaps you do not understand the exactness of anatomy and surgery, but you are quite sure that THE NEW BODY PART SHOULD NOT BE IN THIS PLACE!
Good job!
Well, it's better than nothing!
What have you done, [target_physician.GetFirstName]?!
Operation Mistake
As a result of the operation, the body of this character is slightly weakened and disfigured.
Terrible Operation Mistake
As a result of the operation, the body of this character is weakened and disfigured.
Has not used this decision in the last 10 years\n
Sew Part of Body
Sew a new part onto the body and remove one maimed limb.
§Y[This.GetTitledFirstName]§! is called!

This morning you were told that your [GetFromRelation] [From.GetFirstName] has died. To be more precise, [From.GetSheHe] is no longer among the living. After [From.GetHerHis] death, [From.GetSheHe] was poisoned with necromantic magic and turned into one of those undead creatures.
Now we are on the same side.
What How?
We shared the same fate.

While your prisoner [target_prisoner.GetFirstName] was tied to the surgical table, you prepared everything for the long-awaited operation. [target_prisoner.GetFirstName] attempted to break the restraints or at least scream, but it was all in vain. When my servants made the first cuts, the exhausting groans of the victim echoed in the operating room, which only ceased when [target_prisoner.GetFirstName] lost [target_prisoner.GetHerHis] consciousness from pain and shock.
It will take some time.
I'm stronger than I ever was!

The operation is already a couple of hours through. Your servants were able to open the skull of the prisoner [target_prisoner.GetUyuOgo], and are already prepared to retrieve the most important part of the body - the brain. You need to decide how to deal with the gray matter. You can remove the higher cognitive functions and make the creature more obedient, but this will greatly affect the thinking abilities.
Pieces of meat do not need to think.
§YThe Creation§! will be more loyal!
Try to keep the brain intact.

The operation is almost complete. A monster stitched from the parts of bodies of different people lies upon the table, almost ready to be given life. The sight of this creature will disgust many, but you feel inspired! It has the strength and size of all its ''donors''. Such qualities will be very useful.
Create Monstrous Undead
Use the flesh and brain of this character in order to create a monster. It is advisable to choose an intelligent character.

Another waiting hour passed while [target_physician.GetFirstName] tries to return your body to an acceptable state. Soon, [target_physician.GetSheHe] has a noticeable smile on [target_physician.GetHerHis] face, placing several pins and a set of metal clips onto the wooden surgical table and announcing the long-awaited ''Done!''. You examine your new limb. The operation is done fairly neatly, and your new limb will serve you for a long time.

Your most experienced and loyal servants are fussing around as you lie on the operating table. Next on the wooden tables are set of sets of scalpels, metal clips and threads, which your servants laid out before the operation. Now that all the sets of limbs were carefully delivered to the operating room, the surgeon takes a scalpel and makes a series of neat cuts on your body, then beginning to sew new flesh to you.
It will take some time.

Piles of flesh and extra limbs adorn your body. The muscles and veins of those poor creatures that have fallen victim to the knives of your servants are now a part of you. The horrendous look of your new form will cast fear and awe into the hearts of your enemies and allies, and your newfound great physical strength will lead you to victory on the battlefield, even when up against the most experienced warriors of Azeroth.
Turn yourself into an abomination
Turn yourself into an abomination, a horrific creation that is sewn from a multitude of limbs and parts of the bodies of different beings.
Joins the faction and forms an alliance with every member!\n
Has not tried to join a faction recently\n
The Twilight

Arriving in Azeroth, you noticed that pale-skinned members of your clan changed in behaviour, and began to behave even stranger than before. They were seized with pure ecstasy! This behavior frightens other clans. They do not obey orders and all the time babble about the Hour of Twilight, the end of the world, which they told you about on Draenor. This is alarming. Is the Hour of Twilight close and will it happen here... on Azeroth?
I have to find out what's going on.
Suppress them!

As soon as the first stars began to light up in the sky of Azeroth, you collected all the pale-skinned of your clan at the big fire. You shouted at them absolutely any threats, but they only looked indifferently at you with dark-clouded eyes. ''The Hour of Twilight is near. We hear their voice and you, [Root.GetFirstName], do not change anything anymore'', they almost chorus. Feeling your helplessness, you realized that with them it seems all is over. Nothing prevents you from giving your leader an order to exterminate them.
I lost my clan...

As soon as the first stars began to light up in the sky of Azeroth, you collected all the pale-skinned of your clan from a large clan fire. They told you that the Hour of Twilight is already very close and it will really happen on this planet. About this, pale-skinned told you about some creatures of the abyss, the Old Gods, who were locked up by the Titans in magical prisons deep beneath the earth's crust of this world. This is very strange to you, but it's all very similar to the truth. If the Old Gods and the Void really exist, then who are we to protest their will?
I will take care of it!

Now you too begin to hear the whispers of the old gods. They tell you of the Hour of Twilight, about the Titans, the giant creatures that crushed the Black Empire, and then locked the Old Gods in the very bowels of Azeroth, and about the Void with its incredible power. Now it all makes sense. Every decision in your life has led you to this point, to the Old Gods. You must write down everything that the Old ones whisper to you. A couple of days spent in a quiet room, and you can record all the sermons of your new masters. A book written on the skin of the most faithful cultists, who were madly ready to sacrifice their flesh, will become the beacon of a new faith, and you will become its great prophet!
Hear the voice of the Old Gods!

The [Root.GetDWDevil]'s favours, [Root.GetSocietyRank] [Root.GetFirstName],

The cult has demanded another soul to aid us on our glorious mission. Take [target_mind.GetTitledFirstName] under control and make [target_mind.GetHerHim] your loyal servant - willing or not. Please see to this matter at once.

[Root.GetDWExpression]
Signed, [From.GetSocietyRank] [From.GetFirstName]
The Twilight's Hammer Cult

The Cult of the Twilight's Hammer was created to serve the Void and powerful creatures called the Old Gods. The cultists unconditionally fulfil the will of their lords, bringing the Hour of Twilight closer - the final hour, when traces of life will be snuffed out and the universe will plunge into darkness.
Cultist
Cultist
Shadow Priest
Shadow Priestess
Twilight Lord
Twilight Lady
Hand of the Twilight
Hand of the Twilight
Void Gifts
The Voice from Beyond the Sea

The Hour of Twilight is approaching! The Old Gods decided that you will play one of the key roles. The voice of one of the Old Gods, called C'Thun, calls you to his prison, located on a mysterious continent to the west of here. Your cult must fulfil its mission in relieving the Old Gods from the bonds that the Titans created. Sail west, in search of a continent called Kalimdor, there you will meet your destiny!
I will fulfil the will of the Old Gods!

Your ship has landed at the lifeless sandy shore of a new continent. The area around was dark and gloomy, everything around spoke about the presence of the Old God. As soon as you stepped on the sand of southern Kalimdor, you felt that something was swarming under your feet. From this feeling, you were distracted by the whisper of C'Thun who ordered you to continue your journey further, straight to the ruins of temple structures, whose towers could be seen far ahead, blurring in the hot air of a dead desert.
We must go on.

This desert was far from lifeless. Under the sand and in the air, billions of huge insects, the creations of C'Thun, were swarming. They were enthusiastic about the imminent awakening of their lord. As we approached the huge temple city, their numbers increased. It was under these ruins that the Old God slept. Now your place is here, beside his prison, waiting for the hour when C'Thun will call you.
I'll spread its will across Kalimdor!
The Twilight's Hammer Cult

There are rumors that a new cult has appeared in Azeroth. They call themselves the Cult of the Twilight's Hammer and serve strange ancient creatures that sleep, imprisoned in magical dungeons, deep underground and in the oceans. There is little information about the goals of the Twilight's Hammer cultists, but if you believe those few who are not fortunate enough to encounter them, these fanatics and their lords are waiting for a certain Hour of Twilight, the end of the world, when the whole universe is plunged into eternal darkness.
The master's shadow will cover the world!
Recruit to the Cult
Attempt to find out whether §Y[Root.GetTitledFirstName]§! is open to the power of the occult. If so, you may invite [Root.GetHerHim] to become a member of the Twilight's Hammer Cult.
After you renounced the Loa, you are no longer able to carry its blessings to the far corners of Azeroth. Now that their life-giving forces have left you, you are left alone to fend for yourself.

Recently, the pernicious influence of the Void has changed something in you. You feel its presence around you... They whisper to you, they tell you strange and terrible things, perverting your mind, revealing the darkest corners of your mind.

No more strength to resist their whispers. A thousand voices rumble deep inside your head, leading you on the road to insanity. You are only their pawn, their doll in the game, which has the understanding of an ordinary pathetic mortal.
Aah!

The harmful influence of the Void begins to diminish, but you still feel the traces of its sinister magic within you. All those changes, all those wounds that it caused you, will remain with you and your descendants forever, as punishment for past sins.

There has been too much flow of Void magic into your body lately, filling your tissues and bones with its corrupting influence like an empty vessel. If you do not isolate yourself, its corrupting presence will continue to grow.
You are no longer meddling with the dangerous magic of Void. It gradually leaves your body, freeing you from its harmful influence and leaving only painful reminder and wounds behind.
Void Corruption
Minor Void Corruption
The Void has touched this character, giving them new powers and slowly driving them mad.
Major Void Corruption
This character has become immersed in darkness. [From.GetHerHisCap] body is slowly distorting under the influence of the Void, bringing [From.GetHerHim] great pain and insanity.

The Old Gods and the Void have bestowed upon you a new blessing. One of your hands acquired an abnormal elasticity, developing a strange muscles, similar to the tentacles of mollusks, and considerably lengthened in size. This gift is only one of the gifts of the Old Gods that will lead you to the perfect... true form.

The Old Gods and the Void have bestowed upon you a new blessing. One of your hands is very deformed, covered with a crust that resembles chitin, and began to separate, turning into something like a massive claw. This gift is only one of the gifts of the Old Gods that will lead you to the perfect... true form.

The Old Gods and the Void have bestowed upon you a new blessing. Your body is covered with a lot of chitinous plates and outgrowths, which slowly grow right out of your body. This gift is only one of the gifts of the Old Gods that will lead you to the perfect... true form.

The Old Gods and the Void have bestowed upon you a new blessing. In different places from under your skin large and very sharp keratin thorns were have grown, bringing you considerable pain. This gift is only one of the gifts of the Old Gods that will lead you to the perfect... true form.

The Old Gods and the Void have bestowed upon you a new blessing. Several areas of your skin are coarsened and overgrown with horny plates resembling scales of reptiles or fish. This gift is only one of the gifts of the Old Gods that will lead you to the perfect... true form.

The Old Gods and the Void have bestowed upon you a new blessing. Throughout your body, numerous eyes have grown, which now serve you as additional visual organs. This gift is only one of the gifts of the Old Gods that will lead you to the perfect... true form.
That's... wonderful!

The OlG gods and the Void have bestowed upon you the last blessing. Your body, disorted by numerous mutations under the influence of the Void, has retained only the barely noticeable outlines of your former race. Giant tumors, creepy outgrowths of the body, slimy tentacles... littered your body, turning you into the creation of the deepest abyss of Azeroth, into a creature of nightmares in the service of the Old Gods.
I don't regret anything!
the Fallen Titan
the Old God
