The blessing of the Fel upon you!
The Void is watching you!
You have found a way to get in touch and join [Root.Society.GetName] and are already in the ranks of this secret society.
Can marry or have sexual relations\n

The expedition passed through a fairly large hall with massive granite pillars supporting a huge stone arch. Numerous precious utensils are scattered throughout this room. Golden cups, silver plates and spoons and some other incomprehensible cutlery just lies on the floor. Without a doubt, this is the very treasury we've been looking for. Now that we're done collecting the trophies, we can go to the surface.

Despite all the obstacles, the expedition was able to get to the great artifact. Here it is - the Eye of Sargeras, the great demonic artifact is right here, at arm's length. The magical flows that emanate from it are incredible, they almost push everyone from where they are standing, drowning out the voice of reason. The expedition no longer has any doubts, there is only a desire - a desire to absorb a part of the strength of the Fallen Titan.
I've been waiting for this for so long...
The Nightmares

In recent days you have started to go through terrible nightmares. In these dreams, you were alone in absolute darkness...\nOut of this darkness... voices whispered something to you, showed images of a strange world... You have clearly remembered these frightening landscapes: a stony relief, lined with lava flows, ashes in hot air, blooming in the air of the tower and the obelisks of the temple city are far away from you and... something gigantic was visible on the horizon... you felt His gaze upon yourself. You no longer understood where reality is, but where the dream is.
It was just a dream

The air in the lungs was already beginning to end. Only a dim ray of light from the surface gave you the hope to swim out from under the thick of water... but deep down you knew that there was no hope... He would not let you escape. He wants you. Something tightly grabbed your leg and pulled you down into the abyss. You tried to resist, but He only squeezed your leg, breaking the bones. You screamed in agony, but no one heard your groans from under the water. He dragged you deeper and deeper until the ray of light from the surface completely disappeared. There is no light, no hope. Here, there's only Him and you.

There is no more power to escape. With every breath, the ashes of the burnt forest settle in your lungs, making breathing more difficult. No... you cannot hide from Him. You fall without power into the half-rotten foliage, beside other bodies. Now... when it does not make any sense to escape, it seems to you that the stench of this place has become even stronger. There was a ringing silence, which is interrupted only by the sound of your heart and... a melodic voice in your head. You can hide from Him, but He will always be with you here... in your dreams... in your thoughts... until the moment you lie down in this forest near the other once living beings.

You pressed against the icy stone column, hoping that it did not notice you. Loud tread, the creature slowly enters the spacious hall, dragging its hideous processes behind itself. And then... silence. Your body is shaking from wounds and throat cold, but you are struggling to not make a single sound. ''I hear the beating of your heart,'' the monster says languidly. The column behind you is scattered to pieces, one of which falls on your hand and breaks the bone. The monster straightens, and then raises its gigantic foot above your head.

You hold the dagger in your hands, lifting it over the bound girl. She looks at you, tears flowing down her cheeks. For a moment you freeze in shock. What are you even doing here? A huge dark hall with a stone altar in the center. Around it were disfigured people with tumors. They sing something in an incomprehensible language, swaying from side to side. Where are you? Who are these people? You try to remember how you got here, but the last few hours have disappeared from your memory. You begin to shake, the grip weakens and the dagger starts to slip out of your hands. ''Do it!'' - He says... Well... you cannot deny him.

Nightmares have not visited you for a long time. Dark temples, horrors from the Void, fear and panic - all this remained in your painful memories that left incurable wounds. You can never forget this. They were so detailed, so ... real. Sometimes you really were on the verge of life and death, on the verge of insanity. But now everything is over. And whatever it is, whatever you see in these dreams, you hope that they have left you and will never return. However ... deep down in the soul, you still feel their eyes on yourself.
Everything is over.

These dreams... You do not understand what is reality and what is not. There is something more powerful than you, more powerful than all mortals in this world. Locked and weakened. They want revenge... they want death. You saw them in dreams, you saw their underground dungeons. They showed you the prophecy - what to turn Azeroth into at the end of your life. And along with the prophecy of the end of the world, you saw your destiny. They want you not to resist destiny. You must fulfil the will of the Old Gods!
I'm not their toy!
I obey ...

Inflow of the Void

Deep in the dark forest of the province your scouts came across a strange cube. Apparently, it has been lying here for the last million years. At approach, it is felt that the cube radiates unprecedented darkness, energy of the Void, which all this time poisoned the nearest lands.
The Ancient Creature

Deep in the wilds of your lands your servants found something unusual - a giant immovable armor of some creature. Most of its body is still buried beneath the ground and we can see only the back of this creature, covered with a strong layer of chitin, and its limbs resembling crab claws. It is very surprising how well the remains are. They are in perfect condition - either the creature was buried not for long or the time has stopped for this creature.
Start digging.
This is one of the C'thraxxi! Immediately unearth it!
It's better not to touch it.

Excavations of the ancient creature were in full swing. Nevertheless, more and more often people were in doubt that this creature really was... dead. Chitin, tentacles and other soft tissues were untouched. This suggests that... it just sleeps... waiting. Many have already abandoned this venture and hastily fled from excavation, but this does not prevent us from continuing it and even... waking the creature. It can tell us about many things and be a source of great power, from which it is stupid to refuse.
Invite the mystics.
No, I've had enough.

When the blood rituals of the mystics were completed, a loud roar emanated from the throat of the ancient creature, the chitinous plates began to slide relative to each other with each movement of the creature. Straightening to its full height, its eyes lit up in yellow, and it turned its angry gaze on the people around him. After a couple of moments, the creature raised its gigantic claw and with one stroke carried almost the entire crowd, throwing their bodies a few dozen meters. Those few who survived the first attack tried to escape, but their body did not obey them. Like stone they froze in anticipation of their imminent death.

When the blood rituals of the mystics were completed, a loud roar emanated from the throat of the ancient creature, the chitinous plates began to slide relative to each other with each movement of the creature. Straightening to its full height, its eyes lit up in yellow, and it turned its gaze on the people around him. K'traxi gave his name and told you that he had been lying here since the time of the Black Empire. Now that he is free, the Old Gods want him to stay with you and help you accomplish your task.

The Old Gods highly appreciate your devotion. They gave you new mutations and abilities worthy of their trusted servant: thick chitinous plates covered your body and your mind was endowed with strong mental abilities. The lords rewarded you with a part of their strength so that you can carry their will even when you cannot hear their whispers.
I will not fail the Old Gods!
Reveals the dark side\n
Turn into a bloodsucking vampire.
No, this is a bad idea.
Turn yourself Undead
Turn yourself into an undead, using necromancy.

Everything is ready for the ritual that will put an end to your life. For you, death is only the beginning. The beginning of the immortal kind of being, given to you by the dark craft of necromancy. You are ready to die for this and to be reborn in a completely new form.
Your days in a living body come to an end. The heart stopped, you inhaled the last breath of air before you die and are reborn in a new form - life beyond life. Now all eternity is at your disposal.

Bloodthirstiness has become an integral part of your existence. The obsessive desire again enchaining your thoughts, bringing a little discomfort. And it will intensify if you do not quench your thirst in the very near future.
Need to look for another sheep for slaughter.

the Mighty

A thick fog blanketed the shores of your lands. And though all the winds have faded, a lonely ship appeared on the horizon from the mists. It floated fast through the dark waves to the coast. After this ship, others began to emerge from the fog. Dozens of black, wraped drakkars with tattered sails flew to the shore swiftly. As soon as the ships crashed into the ground with a loud screech, hundreds of disfigured tortured souls jumped off the decks onto the shore, starting to wreak havoc and destruction on your lands.

The Rebirth of the Black Empire

The ancient evil has awakened in the depths of Azeroth. The evil, which was defeated by the Titans thousands years ago, has risen once again. The ancient dark civilization, the Black Empire, has reborn again. Thousands of faithful followers of the Old Gods, led by one leader, have gathered under its twilight banners. Unified as never before, they are chanting the names of their dark lords and proclaiming the beginning of the end. Could this be the beginning of the Hour of Twilight?

Single, but so different. Trying to achieve the same goal, but in different ways. Your thoughts are drowned in their whispers, but among them there is the loudest... the most sonorous and sweet for your hearing.
C'thun... the God of Chaos!
Follower of C'thun

This character is a follower of C'thun. C'thun is the ancient god of chaos, imprisoned in Ahn'Qiraj. Under his influence, a part of the aqirs, born from the living matter of the ancient gods, became a race of qiraji. About a thousand years ago, the expedition of the night elf druids disturbed the peace of his prison, because of which the ancient god awakened the armies of his faithful vassals and their servants, the silithids, and sent them to the elves. The confrontation was completed only with the help of bronze dragons, which sealed Ahn'Qiraj with a magic barrier. Although C'thun is still locked in his temple city, the magic walls do not stop the whispers of the ancient god to reach to the farthest corners of Azeroth.
Yogg-Saron... the God of Death!
Follower of Yogg-Saron

This character is a follower of Yogg-Saron. Yogg-Saron is the ancient god of death, imprisoned beneath Ulduar. Under his influence, a part of the aqirs, born of the living matter of the ancient gods, became the race of nerubians. It is Yogg-Saron who had the honour of creating many races of Azeroth - manipulating his custodian Loken, he managed to impose on the will of the will, the machine for creating the titanides, the Curse of the Flesh, because of which, over time, all the new titanides became flesh, and then began transmitting the disease to the rest the creation of the titans. It was the god of death that sent the Nightmare's seeds to the Emerald Dream, thereby initiating the Emerald Nightmare. Manipulating the custodian Loken, he also managed to disable the remaining jailors of Ulduar. Now Yogg-Saron is considering a further escape plan, calling for the release of his servants from all over Azeroth.
Y'shaarj... the God of Seven Heads!
Follower of Y'shaarj

This character is a follower of Y'shaarj. Y'shaarj is the ancient God of Seven Heads, killed by titan pantheon. Under his influence, a part of the aqirs, born from the living matter of the ancient gods, became the race known as the mantid. Y'shaarj was the strongest ancient god and it was him that the titans first fought. But, by ripping him out from Azeroth, the pantheon caused irreparable damage to the whole world. Y'sharrj's tentacles had for a long time penetrated into the very depths of Azeroth. After his death, his last breath manifested as the Sha, the dark energy that permeated the continent of Pandaria, where his heart is hidden, whose dark pulse does not cease to beat in the minds of his devoted servants.
N'zoth... the God of the Deep!
Follower of N'zoth

This character is a follower of N'zoth. N'zoth is the ancient god of the depths, imprisoned at the bottom of the Great Sea. Being the weakest of the ancient gods, he, however, had no less destructive influence on the world than his brothers. The god of the depths is responsible for the expansion of the Emerald Nightmare generated by Yogg-Saron  he is guilty of clouding the mind of Neltharion, the aspect of the black dragons and his further destruction. In addition, it is assumed that it was he who created the race of the naga when the night elves of Azshara drowned after the Great Sundering. Whatever waters surround his prison, N'zoth's whisper still pierces the minds of his servants on the surface.
Choose Main Old God
Among the four gods, there is one whose whisper is louder than all.
Develop Mutation

When you were left alone, you came to the table. From the very morning, the lord's whisper disturbed your mind, and now the hour of the offering has come. From the sight of the stars, shimmering in the abyss, the witnesses to your crime, a fire of a candle has shuddered and shadows, produced by the light, become running around. Any mortal will be sacrificed, any desire of god will be fulfiled... All for his blessing!
I serve my lord!
God needs more suffering!
My lord, take my blood and flesh!

Dust chocked the eyes and throat, a swarm of small bugs crawls under the skin, a hot wind hits the face, the howl of drums tears my ears. The black scarab rolled the sun beyond the horizon and... the peace came. The sound of the dripping water, the flicker of His purple eye and the whisper: ''I'm pleased...'' Yes, it happened! The lord has paid his attention to you!

Cold has bound the body with chains like iron. Before the eyes the stars rushed past, falling one after another into a gigantic abyss. It stinks of rot from it. The feeling of despair wins and you fall towards the toothy mouth. Scary laughter fills the space, but the flight can not be stopped. Yes, it happened! The lord has paid his attention to you!

The heart beats faster and faster. You hear the crunch of breaking bones, it's you who clenched your fists so much. The pulse grows with every second. A veil of the color of black blood covers the eyes... But then the anger sharply disappears and is replaced by awareness: it's not your heart that pulsates. It's His... Yes, it happened! The lord has paid his attention to you!

Water presses from all sides. A futile attempt to escape loses all meaning as soon as the tentacles compromise your body. You watch how the last rays of the sun disappear into the abyss. And then you lower your head and see... the dark rays of a new dawn. The deep dawn... Yes, it happened! The lord has paid his attention to you!
My lord, let me bring the greatness of Ny'alotha!
My lord, share with me great knowledge!
My lord, grant me countless legions!
My lord, give me the tongue sharper than any sword!

[student.GetFirstName] is already old enough to learn the art of magic and fighting. [mentor.GetTitledFirstName], as a teacher and mentor, can teach the child [mentor.GetHerHis] skills. You only need to choose a direction.
You are already old enough for learning magic and fighting art. Your mentor and teacher, [mentor.GetTitledFirstName], wants to teach you his skills. You only need to choose a direction.
Fury of the Wolf

Difficult times have come to your lands. The threat of defeat in the war is significant. It could turn into an absolute disaster! It's not the first night you spend in your library thinking about it. Turning over the next page of the dusty book, you stumble upon something that could save your country: knowledge of violent wolf-like creatures from the world of dreams, called worgen, and how to open a portal to their world. Their strength and ferocity can be used against your enemies. This is your chance!
I'll send the news to my [target_liege.GetTitle]!
We have no other chance!
No, it's too risky!

The situation in the war leaves much to be desired. Your whole country is under threat. In these difficult times, any opportunity to shift the balance of power is important. [target_mage.GetTitledFirstName] told to you about violent wolf-like creatures from the world of dreams, worgen, and how to open a portal to their world. Their strength and wild savagery can be used against your enemies. This is your chance!
[Root.PrimaryTitle.GetFOA], I agree with your offer. If these wild animals can save our country, then I'm ready for anything.\n\nSubscribed, [From.GetTitledName]

As you did not try to convince your suzerain, he was adamant. ''It's too dangerous! They are just wild animals!'' He kept telling you. The country is on the verge, and [target_liege.GetTitledFirstName] is not able to act decisively. You gave him a chance to win the war, but he refused! Well... then you have every right to take matters into your own hands.
If [target_liege.GetTitledFirstName] does not want to save the country! Then...
I will not go against the will of my liege.

Once everything was prepared for the ritual, you started the opening of the portal. In the first moments, the room was filled with a green mist. You have felt an unusually soothing scent of the forest, which inspires a deep sense of peace. But it did not last long... you noticed yellow eyes staring out of the darkness on that side of the portal. Soon other yellow lights began to light up in the darkness of the world of dreams. They felt thirst for freedom and revenge, burning fury, ready to kill everyone who gets on the arm. Only a glance at these glowing eyes is enough to understand that the worgen can not be controlled. But it was already too late...
I was wrong

In the hope of crushing [Root.GetHerHis] enemies, [Root.GetTitledFirstName] decided to open a portal to the world of dreams in a desperate attempt to find new allies, and encountered a race of wild, wolf-like humanoids, the Worgen. Their animal rage was too much to try and contain, and so they began to attack both [Root.GetHerHis] enemies and allies! Those who were bitten by these creatures have started to transform into Worgen as well.
How did they manage to open a portal to the Emerald Dream?!
Curses!
It's my fault!
[Root.GetTitledFirstName]'s Pack
A pack of wild worgen attacked and ruined [FromFrom.GetName]. Those, who have been bitten, were cursed. Now they became worgen and joined their irrestrainable horde.

He appeared out of nowhere. He jumped on you from the shadows, gnawing at your arm with his fangs. A few moments later he ran away. It has been hours after the bite, and your mind has completely plunged into the abyss of bestial rage. Now you are one of them... one of the worgen.
Rawr!
This morning you have found out that your [GetFromRelation] [From.GetFirstName] was bitten by a wild worgen. In a couple of hours, the curse completely took possession of [From.GetHerHis] mind.
You have read many books from the libraries of Azeroth and not for the first dozen times practiced your magic. The knowledge and experience you gained made you stronger than before.

Behind your shoulders is not the first dozen fights, in which you actively trained the skills of possession of weapons and honed the tactics of combat. The knowledge and experience you gained made you stronger than before.
Level up!
The animal has completely taken over your mind. Together you went with your pack deep into the forests of Azeroth, forever saying goodbye to normal life.

Dull fires in the forest more often loom before your eyes. You smell them... the smell of prey! Having crept closer, you see two peasants. They are hastily trying to find at least a small track of the road from the forest. Easy prey!
However, I will leave them alone.
When he stopped breathing, you looked at the second victim. He stood in shock, sending a torch on you. Does he hope to scare you off? Stupid and weak creatures. His fate is already decided.

The smell of prey led you to a large clearing near the forest. In the middle of this field, far from the village, children are playing. No one would come to their rescue, if you grab one and drag it to the forest! Easy prey!
No, they are just kids!

You quietly crept up in the tall grass on the children, and then with a rapid leap you grabbed one child and began to drag it into the woods by the scruff. The screams of other children flooded the clearing, in the village they began to sound the alarm, but that would not save the child.

Before your eyes, a small ravine was opened in the center of your grove. The smell brought you here... You do not see anything, but you feel that they are hiding somewhere here. These creatures hold you for a stupid animal: they set up traps with meat and wait until you get caught. Presumptuous prey!
They are not worth it.

As soon as the hunters revealed themselves, you attacked them. Your fury was unrestrained, and their cries echoed in the thicket of the forest. You tore them with claws until they turned their faces into a bloody mash. Unfortunate fate... however, they themselves are to blame.

Another booty fell into your paws. The wounded deer tried to run away from you, but you left it no chance. The bloodied animal fell lifelessly to the ground, and you pounced on the carcass like a beast.

Sometimes, through the gusts of animal fury, you hear the voice of reason. What have you become? Feelings of deep guilt tear you from inside, turns inside out. At such times, you are overwhelmed by a desire to return everything as it was... to regain your past life.
I want to defeat the beast inside me!

You could overcome the beast within yourself, but this will not fix all that [Root.GetSheHe]... you managed to do. A load of memories and regrets, and even the curse of the worgen will remain with you for the rest of your life. Nevertheless, it's time for you to return home.

Your days in a living body come to an end. The master gave you a new life, giving you the opportunity to tie your soul to the phylactery. While this phylactery is intact, you are truly an immortal being.
Reincarnate into an ethereal lich.
It's not the first year you've been spinning in the Twisting Nether, hoping to get your physical body. And, finally, your expectation has come to an end. Azeroth calls you again.
You have been resting for a long time in this vessel. During this time, you gained enough strength to restore your physical body and return back to Azeroth.

After the siege of the walls, your troops discovered a phylactery - a vessel containing the soul of a lich, known as [target_lich.GetTitledFirstName]. If you break this vessel, the evil will die in the same second.
Just break it right now!
Let it be.

Your capital was captured, and enemy troops discovered your phylactery. Without much thought, they decided to destroy the vessel of your soul. As soon as the phylactery cracked, you began to leave this world.

After the fall of the Sunwell, your people were trapped in their magical dependence. To their great happiness, you know how to help them quench their thirst.
The Fel will help you!
Look into the Void!
They are not ready!
After the fall of the Sunwell you were trapped in your magical dependence. The hunger for magic overcame you. If you do not find a new source of mana, you will risk dying.
I need a mana crystal!
There must be another way.
I will use the dark magic of my liege.
I can not...

In search of another way, you have found a way to drain mana from absolutely any source of magic. It can be both objects and beings. In addition, arcane magic was not the only way to fulfil your hunger. There are many other more powerful forces that would help alleviate your pain.
Investigate Fel energy
Search for the answer in the Void.
It's time to stop.

Like other magical creatures, demons are a source of powerful magic. However, the connection to the Twisting Nether and the colossal amount of Fel energy in these creations is striking. Their energy can be used to quench the growing hunger of your people, but it can have consequences.

The Void is the source of a pristine, infinitely powerful and very dangerous energy. The beings of the Void are cruel and ruthless. One has only to cross the line and will be in the hands of these terrible creatures. However, if you can control the magic of the Void, you can satisfy the hunger of all your people.
This is a necessary measure!
We will never sink so low!

[Root.PrimaryTitle.GetFOA], I know a way to quench our magical hunger. Besides the Sunwell, there are other sources of magic, and I want to tell you about one of them...

Signed,
[From.GetTitledName]

It's been a long time since those events, and here you are again at home. As predicted by the lord, the plague and wars have ruined these lands. The mortals were too presumptuous and could not resist the onslaught of the Scourge. Now, on their bones the new order shall be built.

[Root.PrimaryTitle.GetFOA], I refuse this dark magic.

Signed,
[From.GetTitledName]
The Restoration of the Sunwell

The day the powers of the Sunwell disappeared was one of the darkest tragedies in the history of the elves. You could not even imagine how the elves were so dependent on the secret magic of its waters. The magical famine claimed tens of thousands of lives, but all of them did not die in vain. The well will be restored - at any cost. And you will do anything to prevent this from happening ever again.
For the Sunwell!
You can no longer continue the restoration of the Sunwell.

After the destruction of the well, you have long thought about the magical dependence of the elves. You saw how brothers and sisters fought against each other to death for mana crystals and other petty sources of mana. No doubt, the Sunwell and the secret magic let you down! Sooner or later, it had to happen. Well, if this secret magic can not help the elves then you know another way.
The Void will help us.
The Fel will help us.
No, I don't want that fate for the elves.

After the destruction of the Sunwell, not all its powers were lost irrevocably. There are rumors that the remnants of its energy were hidden in the body of a young girl. It is the key to its recovery. If you can find it, then the elves have a chance to return the sacred source to former glory.
We need to find her!

At long last, the great wizards of Quel'Thalas found her - a girl with golden hair. She is the only remaining vessel of the Sunwell's energy. And more precisely, it is the pure energy of the Sunwell, which has acquired the form of human. She is your chance to restore the Sunwell! You must save her life at all cost!

The darkness thickened over the island of Quel'danas. Under your command, the great shadow priests of Quel'Thalas began a ritual over the remnants of the Sunwell. The streams of the Void energy from beyond the boundaries of our reality rushed to the plateau, filling the holy place of the elves with the magic of darkness. With the power of the Void, the power of the new Sunwell will surpass its predecessor.

The vortexes of Fel energy swirled over the island of Quel'danas. Under your command, the great warlocks of Quel'thalas began a ritual over the remnants of the Sunwell. Hundreds of demons, hundreds of vessels of Fel were sacrificed on the plateau, filling the holy place of the elves with dark magic. With the power of Fel, the power of the new Sunwell will surpass its predecessor.
The Void will not let us down.
The Fel will not let us down.

The restoration of the Sunwell is almost complete. You already feel how all the plateau pervades the streams of arcane magic. The Avatar of the Sunwell, which took the form of a young girl, has almost completely returned its energy to the Sunwell. But all this may not be enough. However, the holy energy of the naaru, beings of pure light, can help strengthen the Sunwell.
Ask the Naaru for their help in restoring the Sunwell to its former glory.
We do not need the help of the Light.
The Sunwell is Restored

The bright light of arcane magic again shone far on the horizon. As soon as the Avatar of the Sunwell, which took the form of a young girl, returned to the waters of the sacred well of the elves, the Sunwell broke out again. [Root.GetTitledFirstName] and [Root.GetHerHis] closest supporters celebrate a new page in the history of the elves. The hardships and deprivations of the past years are behind them. Including the magical famine, which for a long time tormented the elves. One can say with confidence that the elves went through very dark times for their people, but withstood all odds.

Once the Sunwell had been rebuilt, the dark streams of Void energy rushed from the Sunwell Plateau throughout all of Quel'thalas. [Root.GetTitledFirstName] and [Root.GetHerHis] closest followers celebrate the beginning of a new page in the history of the elves. The Sunwell shines again, but its light is not the same as before. For many, miseries of past years have been left behind. Including the magical hunger, which was tormenting them for a long time. One can say with confidence that the elves went through very dark times for their people, but who knows where their new way will lead them...

Once the Sunwell had been rebuilt, the dangerous streams of Fel energy rushed from the Sunwell Plateau throughout all of Quel'thalas. [Root.GetTitledFirstName] and [Root.GetHerHis] closest followers celebrate the beginning of a new page in the history of the elves. The Sunwell shines again, but its light is not the same as before. For many, miseries of past years have been left behind. Including the magical hunger, which was tormenting them for a long time. One can say with confidence that the elves went through very dark times for their people, but who knows where their new way will lead them...
Restore the Sunwell
It's time to restore the Sunwell in all its past grandeur!
Corrupt the Sunwell
Corrupt the Sunwell with dark magic.
Alterac Mountains
Has not used this decision in the last 2 years\n
Hold Blood Rituals
Hakkar needs more blood! Kill the prisoners! Blood for the blood god!
Hakkar's blessing I
Hakkar's blessing II
Hakkar's blessing III

Hakkar is inexorable. He needs fresh blood, new sacrifices... The blood of mortals, who dared to stand in your way, will again pour on the steps of the altars. Praise the Soulflayer! Let us praise Hakkar!
Praise Hakkar!

As soon as your captors pulled the bag off your head, you saw a sacrificial pit with dozens of mutilated corpses. After a moment, you felt your blood spatter from your severed neck. Your sight began to darken and soon your lifeless body fell into the pit with the rest of the sacrificed.

You have proven that you are able to shed the blood of your enemies in the name of Hakkar. But what about your own blood? Are you ready to sacrifice it to the Soulflayer and show yourself as his faithful follower?
Yes!
I can not...

Usually the bodies of those who were killed during the rituals are left to rot in the sacrificial pits, but sometimes there are those who decide to taste the flesh of the dead. Are you ready to join the bloody feast?
Yes!
I'm not interested.

The blood rituals came to an end. Only the sacrificial pits filled with rotting corpses, and the dried black blood on the steps of the altars testifies to the horrors that occurred in your possession. The Soulflayer is pleased with you.

[Root.PrimaryTitle.GetFOA], I want you and your people to participate in the ritual ceremonies in my lands.

Signed,
[From.GetTitledName]

[Root.PrimaryTitle.GetFOA], I can not take part in the rituals.

Signed,
[From.GetTitledName]
Many different clans gathered here to sacrifice and appease the spirits and elements of Azeroth. All of them watched tremendously at the beginning of the ceremony.
It's your turn to make a sacrifice. The shamans and the whole crowd anxiously await from you unprecedented generosity to appease the evil spirits. But what can you offer them?
The blood of my captives.
My blood.
Animal blood.
Meh, nothing?

During one of the ceremonies, for no particular reason, [target_murderer.GetFirstName] publicly stabbed [target_victim.GetFirstName] with a dagger into the chest [target_victim.GetSheHeCap] fell to the ground with the crowd only mocking the weakling and soon after dispersed.
The strongest survives.
Will [target_murderer.GetSheHe] just go unpunished?

After the end of the next rite, you are confronted by [target_ruler.GetFirstName]. After a little brawl with [target_ruler.GetEyIm], you decided to feast together. Despite all [target_ruler.GetHerHis] minuses, [target_ruler.GetSheHe] rendered a good companion.
During one of the rituals, one of the oldest and most respected shamans turned to you. He said that the spirits pronounced your name. They predict great things for you in the future.
I will not let them down.

After one of the ceremonies, you were invited to a feast, which is conducted by the most notable births. Entering under the inconspicuous linen canopy, you saw mountains of various dishes. The feast is in full swing.
Join the feast.
Not today.
The rituals have come to an end. The shamans said that even the harshest of spirits are pleased with us. Numerous clans gathered from distant lands, leaving behind freshly buried sacrificial pits.
Sacrificed to the spirits
Hold Rites
Invite all your vassals to the rites to honour the spirits.
Trol'kalar

The legendary sword of Ignaeus Trollbane, the great general of the Arathorian Empire, which later became the regalia of the Trollbane family. The glory of the sword lies in its ability to deal with any troll with just a couple of strokes.
Crown of Stromgarde

The Crown of Stromgarde, a family relic of the Trollbane dynasty to which the first king of Stromgarde was crowned, after the descendants of the great king Thoradin abdicated the throne under the pressure of the aristocracy of the collapsing empire.
Ignaeus' Gauntlets

A family relic of the Trollbane dynasty, which were worn by many outstanding generals of this family. Ever since Ignaeus Trollbane, the ancestor of the Trollbane dynasty and the great general of the Arathorian Empire, military education has been a family pride.
Mantle of Stromgarde
This mantle used to be a part of the once great Arathian Empire's flag, which the ancestors of the Trollbanes' preserved and wore as a cloak after the empire's fall.
Trollbane Sigil Ring

A golden ring with the richest gems, this ring is a direct proof of the incredible wealth of the Trollbane family, which they earned over many centuries of owning a multitude of mines in the Arathi Highlands.
Ignaeus' Chalice
Now a cherished relic of the Trollbanes', which, according to legend, Ignaeus Trollbane drank from when he feasted with the great king Thoradin himself after the defeat of the Amani Empire.
Doomhammer

The Doomhammer was forged in a basin of pristine lava on Draenor and passed from father to son for decades. Despite its oversized dimensions, this hammer absorbed the strength of elementals and is capable of inflicting a crushing blow to any enemy.
Soul Shard
The violet stones, in which the souls of the unfortunate are imprisoned, are used by warlocks to enhance their twisted, dark magic.
Frostmourne

This sword, dotted with dark runes, was forged by the nathrezim. The souls of living creatures killed by Frostmourne remain trapped in it forever and its blade can easily cut flesh, bones and the most durable metals.
Twilight Canticle
This book contains inscrutable knowledge about the Void and the Old Gods. The pages are made of the flesh and skin of faithful followers, who gave their lives for the sake of the will of their lords.
Xal'atath, Blade of the Black Empire

Nobody knows exactly when this blade was created, but by old tales apparently it was used for sacrifices in ancient times. Its millennia-old runes dribble with the magic of the Void. At times one could hear faint, almost exhausted whispers from the blade slowly growing upon those with a weak mind.
The Blade of the Black Empire

Your servants informed you that a humpbacked wrinkled old man arrived at your court. He offers you his gift: an elegant black runic blade with a handle adorned with an ominous eye. If you accept his gift, the elder promises not to disturb you any more. Although the old man does not look like a credible person, but... this blade really beckons you with its aura of antiquity and mystery. It can become an excellent trophy in your treasury.
I accept the gift.
No, take him away.
This is Xal'atath! Give it to me!

After you took over that ritual blade, you began to hear voices. During that couple of days, while it was in your hands, you were ceaselessly having nightmares, which were cut off by the gentle whispers of Xal'atath. You lost your mind? Or is this blade cursed and he tries to speak to you? The blade beckons you!
Xal'atath is calling me!
Throw it out of here!

One night, you, led by the whispers of Xal'atath, secretly crept into the treasury. There, a black blade told you about hundreds of dark secrets of Azeroth: in the farthest corners of this world there lives a true madness, a first-born evil. In ancient times, Xal'atath shed blood of the sea for the sake of this evil... but now these times are behind... Your determination amuses Xa'alath, he is ready to guide you... for now.

Xal'atath is a creation of the Void itself. Born of darkness, it knows a lot of secrets about the shadows and its creatures. The Void is one of the fundamental forces in the universe, one of its foundations, but one should not think that it is only an instrument in your hands.. At times your conversations with Xal'atath would last for hours, but your knowledge is still incommensurable small compared to its.
Xal'atath, tell me about the Void.
Xal'atath, tell me about the Old Gods.
Never mind...
In the heat of battle for [target_province.GetName] you heard the whisper of Xal'atath: ''Free the power of the Void, hidden in me! Let your enemies scream in agony! ''
Kill them all!
It's not worth it.

Darkness has covered the battlefield in [GetName.target_province]. As the first surge of Void energy rushed from the blade of the Black Empire, everyone who was in the path of the darkness, died in torment. Their screams and dark mutilated corpses instilled fear in those who were fortunate to survive it.
Terrifying power...

You discovered that an ancient ritual blade disappeared from your treasury. No one saw the thieves, although it was guarded all day and all night. It seemed to disappear into thin air... but you still hear the echoes of its sinister laughter.
You promised

Suddenly, you felt that an invisible force grabbed you by the throat. The sinister laughter of Xal'atath was ringing in your head: ''You've become too weak!'' With every moment of breathing it's getting harder... the darkness consumes you.
Argh!
Strange...

When you learned about Medivh's death, you almost lost the hope in gaining immortality, when suddenly this strange map got into your hands. It shows the possible location of the Broken Isles. A large red blot on it marked a certain structure. Can this be the Tomb of Sargeras? Anyway, you have no other choice.

There were many rumors behind your back. Those who knew you very closely, clearly noticed a change in you, but did not give it more importance. How wrong they have been! But now everyone knows what you did. There is no more meaning to hide your true intentions.
Rage of Fire

You're losing the war. Your troops suffered many defeats and let the enemy into your lands. These cowards are not even able to protect their kingdom, what can we say about the seizure of Khaz Modan! Your last hope of winning is to find another weapon against the hostile clans. The power of the elements that sleeps under this place can draw enemy troops into the ashes! They will still see the power of the Dark Iron Clan!
Convene the best mages!
We will do without the help of magic!

For the ritual you found the best mages of your clan. When you were casting the spell, you used all your fury, all your hatred to crush your enemies. All your losses and defeats flashed before your eyes, and giant fire whirlwinds burst from the center of the ritual circle, instantly turning into ashes all summoners and charring your skin. The outlines of a giant elemental began to emerge from this fiery chaos. The heat radiating from it slowly tore the flesh from your bones, bringing unthinkable pain
Aaa!

Ashes, which escaped with a stream of lava from the newly formed volcano, covered most of the Redridge Mountains. The heat, charred the skin of those who were nearby, and burned most of the buildings to ashes. The fiery chaos under the gaze of the fire lord Ragnaros swept the Redridge Mountains. His faithful lieutenants and legions of elementals for a long time raged in the vastness of Azeroth, subordinating local creatures to their will and turning these lands into a scorched desert.
Terrible...

Miserable mortal, bow to the power of fire and the might of our lord, Ragnaros,

Signed,
[From.GetTitledName]
I don't have any other choice.
I obey, but...
No, I will not!

Offer Gift to the Elements
Offer a gift to the elements with the hope that they will give you their blessing.

You went to the place of offering to the elements. Noble, poor, homeless - you all go shoulder to shoulder to the sacrificial altar. You all are trifles for eternally raging elements. Stepping forward to the altar, you prepared to make your sacrifice
I listen to the words of my lord!
I'm ready to give everything!
My life belongs to the lord!

The elementals accepted your sacrifice. You, kneeling before the viceroy of the lord, were endowed with a blessing. Use it to spread his will into the furthest corners of Azeroth - and remember, the elements always watch over you.
Element Blessing I
Element Blessing II
Element Blessing III

Dark Crystal

Traveling across Azeroth, from the corner of your eye you noticed a dull glint on the ground. It was a large black sphere, covered with a handful of loose soil. Sun glints on it were barely noticeable, as if almost all the light was absorbed by this mysterious object. You felt darkness radiating from it. But somewhere in the depths of this blackness you sensed something, light - like it was trapped inside the crystal.
Touch the crystal.
Ignore it and march on.

As soon as you touched the crystal, the darkness quickly crept up your arm. To your happiness, thanks to the reaction, you managed to pull it off, but your limb was struck to the elbow. Strong burning pain tied it, but soon went on recession. Although you did not lose your hand, it was extremely weakened, the skin turned black, and the pain is still tormenting you. As for the crystal...
I need to be careful with it.
Throw out this thing!
Ashes to Ashes

You have always felt the small presence of light in that black crystal, which is stored in your treasure chest. In these dark days, your hope that it can become the most powerful weapon in the fight against evil has grown stronger. You have already noticed how this sphere absorbs the light... Is it possible that you can purify the crystal? In any case, you do not have many choices.
We need to try.

Along with other priests and paladins, you began to transfer the energy of the Light into the crystal. Absorbing the magic it began to shine dimly. Slowly but surely the sphere was filled with the Light. When you were finished, the radiance of the once dark crystal blinded your sight, the streams of light enveloped the whole room. You have never felt such a strong presence of the Light, as it warmed your skin with its gentle embrace.
We must forge a weapon from the crystal!

You gave the glowing crystal to the best dwarven smiths you could find. The forging and the whistling of the blacksmith's bellows continued to be heard over the closed gates of the forge. To you it seemed like it took forever. Finally, when the doors swung open, the smiths appeared before you with a shining blade, a halo of holy, cleansing flames surrounding it. As soon as you took hold of the sword, you felt the power of the Light within the sword and with it you could bring down the forces of evil.
I'll wipe it off the face of the earth!
Dark Crystal
Void magic emanates from this strange crystal, but somewhere in the depths of it you feel the presence of the Light.
Ashbringer
This sword has been forged from the crystal of pure light. Faced with it, any evil being will be turned into ashes by its purifying light.
Has an alternative class
Has physical and magic classes
Rare Beast is Caught

During your expedition, you stumbled upon the trail of a poisonous raptor. Locals said that they are very rare in these parts. You immediately gave an order for its capture. Fortunately, under your command are some of the best trappers of Azeroth. After a couple of days, the rare beast was in your hands.
Send it to the capital!

[Root.PrimaryTitle.GetFOA], I hasten to inform you that our expedition caught a rare beast. The creature trapped inside one of our cages has already been sent to the capital.

Signed,
[From.GetTitledName]
Wild Beasts Attacked the Camp

They ambushed at night when the entire camp slept, we were taken by surprise. The guards quickly fell to the wild beasts that soon lashed out at the others. Without weapons we barely had any chance to survive.
Grab the guns!

You hastily grabbed your rifle and aimed at the feral beasts, after a couple of shots the first three creatures fell dead. The firing within the camp lasted only a couple of moments. As soon as the smoke cleared, you saw that the camp was full of animal corpses. You survived this attack with minimal losses.

As soon as you grabbed your pistol, the beast bit into your hand. With one deft movement you directed the gun at it and pulled the trigger. When the smoke cleared, the beast lay in a pool of its blood. The rest of the animals fled into the forest. You survived this attack with minimal losses.

As soon as you took hold of the rifle, the beast clung to your throat. Warm blood flowed down your neck, soaking into your clothes. Your body was paralyzed. You fell down to your knees and the wild animal dug even deeper into your neck, as if it's trying to break your spine.
My wound still hurts.

Today you received news that wild beasts attacked your expedition. Although the animals caught them off guard at night, they survived this attack with minimal losses, but [From.GetTitledName] was wounded.

Today you received news that wild animals attacked your expedition. They ambushed the camp in the middle of the night, taking your men by surprise. [From.GetTitledName] and many others were in the clutches of beasts and were torn to pieces alive.

An explorer arrived at your court. Tired of [target_explorer.GetHerHisCap] long wanderings, [target_explorer.GetSheHe] decided to stop in your domain. [target_explorer.GetHerHisCap] stories amaze people. Maybe [target_explorer.GetSheHe] can come in handy...
Hire [target_explorer.GetHerHim]!
No, this is a bad idea.

[Root.PrimaryTitle.GetFOA], you are known as a great warrior and faithful follower of the Light. I urge you to become a defender of the Light - a paladin.

Signed,
[From.GetTitledName]
For the Holy Light!
Becomes a paladin\n
I don't have time for this.
Blood and Silver

After the Light left the kingdom of Lordaeron, the division happened among paladins and priests. Broken and depressed  many servants of the Light swore to restore their homelands at all costs and purify the eastern kingdoms of all evil and conquerors in behalf of the survival of the human race. The majority of the warriors of the Light joined their scarlet banners, but not everyone was ready to put up with the attitude of the newly-formed Scarlet Crusade. Those who had not accepted their fanatical philosophy, created their own order  the Argent Dawn.
Support the Argent Dawn.
Lordaeron must be purged!
Religious Division
Religious Division
Purge Lands of [Title.GetBaseName]
You can purge these lands, because you think they are occupied by unholy beings.
Stop Invader
This character is an alien invader that threatens the security of the whole world. It is able to conquer entire realms. You must stop it before it's too late!
Terror of the Tides

The rumors about an invasion from the depths have spread across Azeroth. Mysterious sea creatures, called naga, went ashore from under the wild waves. Only few that faced them survived. Some were killed, others disappeared. After the displacement of coastal inhabitants was finished, the naga started to build their fortifications. Everything suggests that they decided to stay here, however, their real motives are unknown.
Interesting...
The next move of my lords!

They appeared from beneath the waves. In a matter of hours, hundreds of serpentine creatures flooded the coast of [target_province.GetName]. The unfortunate victims of this ambush were either killed or taken into slavery. As soon as they occupied the coast, their troops began to move deeper inland.
Exodus of the Horde

You and your race have paid dearly for your mistakes. Orcs tried to take Azeroth by force and were defeated. Many were captured and enslaved, others wandered around the world in search of temporary asylum. It was not the life that your ancestors desired, but there is still hope! In a dream, a vision of a mysterious prophet came to you. He said that to the west of these lands lies another continent - Kalimdor. There the orcs will find their own destiny!
This is our chance for a peaceful life!
No, we will conquer the Eastern Kingdoms!

[Root.PrimaryTitle.GetFOA], I would be glad if your people would sail with me to the distant shores of Kalimdor.

Signed,
[From.GetTitledName]

[Root.PrimaryTitle.GetFOA], my clan and I wish to sail with you to Kalimdor.

Signed,
[From.GetTitledName]

As soon as you left the coastal waters of Lordaeron, a storm suddenly broke out. Fortunately, in the black haze you saw an island in the ocean. Your ships were badly damaged, but, at least, you saved them. On the island you met a tribe of friendly trolls, which volunteered to help you. However, there were not only them. Strange snakelike creatures, along with murlocs, assaulted the island, killing and snatching all the living creatures.
We need to repair the ships and get out of here!

Black clouds were gathering over the islands. For several generations your people have never seen such a violent storm. When the darkness vanished, you spotted the wreckage of foreign ships on your shores. It were orcs who have found a shelter on your isles during their long journey. However, they were not the only ones the storm brought to you. Strange snakelike creatures, along with murlocs, assaulted the island, killing and snatching all the living creatures.
We must survive!

You fought side by side with the trolls. Here, on the island forgotten by the gods, you found in them faithful allies. However, even the united strength of the orcs and trolls can no longer restrain the countless legions of sea creatures. Most of the ships were almost ready. On them you can fit all of your people... but you would have to leave the trolls here to die.
We will not leave them behind!
Retreat to the ships!

You fought side by side with the orcs. Reflecting attack after attack, you found in them loyal allies. However, even the united strength of the orcs and trolls can no longer restrain the countless legions of sea creatures. When all the ships were ready, the orcs invited you to flee with them. Without hesitation, you got into the ships and sailed with your new allies farther west - into the mysterious lands of Kalimdor.

You fought side by side with the orcs. Reflecting attack after attack, you found in them loyal allies. However, even the united strength of the orcs and trolls can no longer restrain the countless legions of sea creatures. When most of the ships were ready, you heard the call of the battle horn. Orcs retreating to the ships? You cannot believe it! They left you at the mercy of these sea creatures! Now you are alone with the horrors from the depths...
Maybe our destiny lies here?
Damned orcs!

After a long voyage across the Great Sea, the red flags of the Horde flew off the eastern shores of Kalimdor. In short time, orcs and their new allies built the first fortifications on the uninhabited land of the mainland. Having lost their homeland and all hope of a quiet life, many of them were already calling this place their new homeland. But only time will tell what fate awaits them here.
It was a long journey.
Join the Black Empire
Join the Black Empire and become one of the vassals. §RIf you have imperial titles, then you will lose them.§!

Founding of Theramore

Many residents of the Eastern Kingdoms have been left without food and shelter. War, hunger and disease took from them everything they had: a house, friends... a family. As long as the Eastern Kingdoms burn in flames, they have no chance to survive, but there is still hope! In a dream, a vision of a mysterious prophet came to you. He said that to the west of these lands lies another continent, Kalimdor. There, these refugees will find their fate.
I will save these people!
This is madness!

The ships, slightly nipped with fierce winds and storms of the Great Sea, appeared near the shores of Central Kalimdor. The colourful flags of various eastern kingdoms proudly fluttered on their masts. Those who lost their home, friends and family, went to seek the shelter from wars, hunger and diseases far to the west - in the mysterious lands of Kalimdor. Perhaps, here they will find their own destiny!
We are safe now.
Reawakening of C'thun

The dark dunes of Silithus have never been a safe place. The dry wind of the dead desert, annoying insects, which sometimes can simply drag you under the ground or lift you up into the air. However, recently they have become even more hostile and dangerous than usual. Something dark has always been hidden beneath the crests of the sand. Now, it has awakened again. The giant insects swarm over the ruins of Ahn'Qiraj to bear witness to the awakening of their dark master.
The Qiraji will devour them all!
The ancient evil must remain in confinement!
Crashlanding of Exodar

In the far reaches of the west, a falling star has crashed upon the relatively peaceful island of Azuremyst. It revealed a massive construction of otherworldly origin, while its crystals scattered across the island chain, contaminating the local ecosystem. In addition, the inhabitants of the strange structure have revealed themselves to be the Light-wielding descendants of the Eredar civilization of Argus, who have escaped the Burning Legion's wrath on the crumbling remains of the world of Draenor, which served as their refuge from their demonic brethren for many decades.
May the Light guide them!
They can run, but they can not hide!
Those pathetic curs will find only death in this world.
This is an unexpected turn of events.
Burn Evil Beings
Burn all unholy characters as evil beings. They deserve to die!
§Y[This.GetBestName]§! is sentenced to be burnt\n

You fought in the heat of battle alongside your soldiers. When the first unfortunate enemy soldier died by your hand, his blood splashed onto your tunic. You quickly rushed to the next opponent with a deafening cry!
Forward!
Conjure Food
Use your magic to conjure food to improve the opinions of others about you.

Your magic can work wonders. Creating food and wine literally from thin air, you are able to surprise any audience: from the richest aristocrats to the homeless poor. However, your tricks are not enough for us all, so a choice must be made.
The poor.
The nobility.
Never mind...
Conjured Food for Poor
Conjured Wine for Nobility

As a true connoisseur of magic, you often spend many hours researching the secrets of the universe. And so, you again decided to devote a couple of months of your life to exploring the secrets of arcane magic.
Let's get started!
No, not today.

While doing your research, you felt a clear lack of knowledge. Many ancient volumes have already turned into dust or got lost from the shelves of your library. To continue your work, you must purchase new books.
Send a courtier.
No, it's a waste of money!

For several nights, sitting and studying the arcane without a break, you let out a yawn. Even a magician like yourself needs rest, because no magic can protect you from the lack of sleep and fatigue. A few hours of sleep wouldn't hurt.
I must continue my research!
I'll take a nap.

In your magical research, you sometimes resorted to testing in practice. There were signs of trouble. You tried to test another safe spell, but something went wrong. A flash, an outburst of fire... and suddenly you found yourself on the verge of life and death.

At the end of your long search, you feel that you are at an impasse. You re-read many volumes of various books, but could not find anything of interest at all. You may have been looking in the wrong places, but you might not have been looking over here! Now it is not so important anymore...

After your long research, you finally feel that you are standing at the threshold of new discoveries. In the ancient books, you discovered the skill of creating short-term portals over long distances. Unfortunately, living beings will not survive this journey, but through these portals you could transport cargo.

After your long research, you finally feel that you are standing at the threshold of new discoveries. In ancient books, you discovered the secret mastery of telekinesis, which allows you to lift heavy objects into the air. It could significantly speed up and reduce the cost of the construction process in your domain.

After your long research, you finally feel that you are standing at the threshhold of new discoveries. In ancient books, you discovered the mastery of mass creation of dishes and wines from pure magical energy. With this opportunity, you have a chance to feed all the hungry in your realm. For years to come, your people will not know of hunger!
Magical Secrets: Teleportation
Magical Secrets: Telekinesis
Magical Secrets: Food Conjuring

After your long research, you finally feel that you are at the threshold of new discoveries. In ancient books, you discovered the knowledge of resurrecting the dead. Even if the creature was already dead, you can return its soul to this world. You can continue your search, but if you cross this line, then there is no way back.

After your long research, you finally feel that you are standing at the threshold of new discoveries. In ancient books, you found information about the powerful energy of the Fel. It is a dark force that feeds on the life force of the living and gives the demons their power. You can continue your research, but if you cross this line, there will be no turning back.

After your long research, you finally feel that you are standing at the threshold of new discoveries. In ancient books, you found information about... the Old Gods and the twisted magic of the Void. Not many were able to curb this force and remain sane. You can continue your research, but if you cross this line, there will be no turning back.
I want to know more!
NO!

the Thunderbringer

After many years of peace and quiet, the rumors of ''death cults'' began to circulate in the northern provinces. The cults attracted the disenfranchised and disheartened citizens of Lordaeron, offering them ''eternal life'' on earth as an alternative to the servitude to the king. King Terenas knew that troubles were only just beginning for his land. He took some comfort in the fact that Lordaeron had endured every trial that had ever come its way  and that its defenders, both new and old, would see it safely through to a new dawn

You received news that your [GetFromRelation] [From.GetFirstName], under the influence of the Fel, abandoned [Root.GetHisHer] own body in favour of an immortal existence on the edge of the physical world and the demonic Twisting Nether.
You received news that your [GetFromRelation] [From.GetFirstName] fell under the influence of dark forces, which strive to plunge Azeroth into the abyss of chaos and suffering
[From.GetSheHeCap] is not my [GetFromRelation] anymore!
Escape from the dungeon\n
Scythe of Elune

The Scythe of Elune is a mystical artifact created from Goldrinn's fang and the Staff of Elune. It is described as an ancient weapon - a twisted and gnarled branch of wood covered with runes, which could be even older than the Kaldorei. Those who are not careful enough, could easily be overwhelmed by Goldrinn's spirit, which infuses the scythe. Tied to the origin of the worgen on Azeroth, the scythe is said to possess untold lunar power for the druid with balance enough to keep control.
Silver Hand

As one of the titanic watchers, keeper Tyr bore this weapon in countless battles against the titans' enemies. When one of his fellow keepers, Loken, fell to corruption, Tyr and his allies stole the Discs of Norgannon to investigate the extent of Loken's betrayal. Discovering the theft, Loken sent horrific monsters after Tyr's group, but Tyr sacrificed his life to fight the creatures while his comrades escaped with the discs.
Aluneth
This mysterious staff is the source of great magic. Although Aluneth's origin is unknown, the civilization that created it, had a very deep knowledge of arcane magic.
Apocalypse

Vampiric demons known as nathrezim forged this ancient sword, which brings with it violence, plagues, and death. Apocalypse soon earned a horrific reputation in the hands of a Tirisgarde mage who couldn't control its destructive energies.
Scepter of Sargeras

Before the eredar served the titan Sargeras, one of their greatest leaders, Thal'kiel, had unprecedented skill with summoning and binding magics. Driven by ambition, he reached into the Void and was answered with knowledge of dark creatures unlike any the eredar had seen before. Thal'kiel's apprentice, Archimonde, discovered his master's dark pact and revealed it to Thal'kiel's fellow rulers, who banded together to strike Thal'kiel down. After his defeat, they had his skull gilded and placed on display as a warning.
Atiesh

Atiesh, the greatstaff of the Guardian is a powerful staff passed down through the line of the Guardians of Tirisfal. The staff was born from the ''seed of hate'' and grants its wielder ''unending power''. It was passed down by each Guardian of Tirisfal to its successor.
Book of Medivh
The spellbook written by Medivh.

Use Poisonous Gas
Use poisonous gas against §Y[Root.GetTitledName]§! to make [Root.GetHerHim] incapable for a while.
Has Been Poisoned by Gas

While you were in your chambers, you noticed that a strange figure slipped into the doorway behind your back. A moment later, the whole room was filled with green gas. You rushed out of there, covering your face with your hand.

At midnight your assassin made it into [From.GetFirstName]'s chamber with a sealed container of deadly gas. The container was put down next to one of the beds and the assassin broke its seal before swiftly slipping out through the door, closing it silently behind him as the gas seeped out from the container. Nobody saw or heard anything of your assassin, who quickly escaped out of the castle. The mission was a success!

In the middle of the night your assassin made his way to [From.GetFirstName]'s chamber with a sealed container of deadly gas. Your assassin, however, managed to damage it while climbing up over the castle walls. He soon felt weak and fell to the cold floor where he choked on the gas, which seeped from the container... Your assassin was found dead by guards on patrol in the early morning.

In the middle of the night your assassin made his way to [From.GetFirstName]'s chamber with sealed containers of gas. He placed one at the bedside and broke its seal before making a hasty retreat through the door as the gas seeped from the container. With the few extra containers he had, he thought it would please you, if he set them in the other nearby rooms to ensure [From.GetFirstName] perished to the poisonous gas.

Adopting Tribal Monarchy will convert all your tribal holdings into castles. When this occurs - if the county is big enough - city and temple holdings will also be created if they do not already exist. Your vassals are likely to follow if they are of your religion and culture.
Unholy Architecture

Most recently you have hatched from an egg, surrounded by the yapping of the other hatchlings of your dragonflight. You are still tiny, but dragons can grow up to colossal sizes. Perhaps, one day you may become the largest creature of your kind.

Much time has passed since you hatched from the egg. Though now you can fly over the endless fields and forests of Azeroth and your form appears to be that of an adult dragon, but your kindred still disdain you.

Not the first decade is under your belt, not many relatives can surpass you in wingspan and strength. Your size and graceful form instills fear and magnificence in the hearts of enemies and allies alike.

The kingdoms of the mortals were created and destroyed right in front of your eyes. The land is shaking under your paws. A flap of your wings can crook trees in several miles around you. Your enemies make a hasty retreat once your shadow covers them.

[From.GetTitledName], one of your neighbours is engaged in the bloody war against the forces of evil. Many encourage you to forget about all your disputes and quarrels and join the war immediately. If [From.PrimaryTitle.GetFullBaseName] falls, you will be next.
We will join the war!

You are dead, but you still have to worry about your heir, who will take your place if the dark magic can no longer bring you back into this world. [target_new_member.GetTitledFirstName] has become even more loyal after [From.GetHerHis] death. Among all the other dead, [target_new_member.GetSheHe] is the best candidate.

Though your soul is formally immortal, you still need to worry about your heirs, who will continue your work if you do not return from the Twisting Nether. [target_new_member.GetTitledFirstName] would be the perfect candidate to lead your legions in the future.

The world is a dangerous place and accidents can happen, perhaps you could break down in combat or for other reasons, but there is a remedy to secure your legacy. [target_new_member.GetTitledFirstName] is a simple construct, but if you shared part of your life spark with him he could carry on your legacy should something happen to you.

Among all other creatures of the Void, there is one which has deserved your trust. Mortals call it [target_new_member.GetTitledFirstName]. When you will return to the darkness again, it will be able to take your place.

[target_new_member.GetTitledFirstName] is the most loyal to your court. You cannot remember a single case where [target_new_member.GetSheHe] has let you down. Perhaps one day [target_new_member.GetSheHe] will be able to continue your work...
[target_new_member.GetTitledFirstName] is a good choice.

You feel how the Light is shooting through your veins with every beat of the heart, strengthening your body and spirit.
Damned [FromFrom.GetFirstName] has cursed your body with the Light. Streams of the holy energy penetrate you like stakes, tearing you from the inside and bringing an unbearable pain.

Not many can resist the dark magic of the Void. Despite all of your efforts, [target_crazy.GetTitledFirstName] found the strength to ward off all the dark thoughts.

You wanted to turn the Void against your enemies, but it spares no one. Darkness has crept into your mind and turned your thoughts inside out. The last scraps of your mind slowly leave you, while you sink deeper and deeper into the abyss of madness.
Shut up!

You do not understand what is happening to you. Every time you are alone, you see previous events of your life, all of them differing from each other. The regrets of your past torment you, while the voice in your head whispers terrifying prophecies.
Bad Voodoo
Do wicked things! Curse [From.GetHerHim] with diseases and nightmares!

Only stars in the sky witnessed your dark voodoo. All night long you were tirelessly dancing a ritual dance. Thousands of phantom eyes were watching your ecstatic dance. Since the evil spirits are on your side now, it's time to bring their anger down on your enemies.

You constantly feel someone's presence next to you. As if hundreds of spirits were flying around you, circling, laughing like madmen. It seems like you are slowly going crazy, maybe because of some sort of dark magic. Their laughter in your mind won't leave you, not for a second, turning your life into pure madness.

Weakness has intertwined into your mind and body. You constantly hear echoes of the mad spirits laughter. They are giggling at what you've been turned into. There is no doubt that your troubles were caused by the dark magic of your foes.
Your body and spirit are growing stronger with every passing day. On your fingertips you feel the power floating in the air. Hundreds of phantom eyes are watching over you.
Time is passing, but your dark voodoo doesn't seem to work. [target_doll.GetFirstName] even didn't feel your magic. Perhaps the spirits understood you wrong.

Time is passing, but your dark voodoo doesn't seem to work. [target_doll.GetFirstName] became even stronger and wiser than [From.GetSheHeCap] was before. It seems to you that the spirits even protect [target_doll.GetHerHim]. Perhaps they understood you totally wrong.
You should have bewitched [target_doll.GetHerHim]!

When the rift into the Twisting Nether was opened, you saw the silhouette of a huge creature on the other side. Its tentacles reached to you. The Frostwolf Clan Exodus

Rumours have passed  the Frostwolf clan, ruled by honorable orc [Root.GetTitledFirstName] have found their new home in [Root.Capital.GetName]. Rejecting the authority and breaking up the ties with the Horde, now they set their goal to cultivate their new land and take care of the tribe's future. If other clans would say the Frostwolves are traitors of the Horde, these orcs are convinced that what they do is for the good  as they follow the clan's ideals. Perhaps this wil have its effect on all orcs that have arrived in Azeroth recently...
Frost-who?
This is the beginning of a new life for our clan.
These rats cannot hide from the Horde!

Durotan, son of Garad and father of the future Warchief Thrall, was the Chieftain of the Frostwolf Clan. Relations between the Frostwolf and the Blackrock clans were not the best even before the invasion of Azeroth  Gul'dan, which is known as a puppeteer managed to convince Blackhand that Durotan is a traitor as he declined to accept the Demonic Bargain  the blood of Mannoroth. When the Horde crossed over into Azeroth, Durotan continued to voice oppose against the Horde leadership which led Gul'dan to exile Durotan and his entire clan.
Good Bye, Horde!

The Horde finally landed on Azeroth, and prepared their camp. Only a couple of days are left, and then the orcs will launch their offensive under the guidance of [From.GetBestName]. For us, this is the time to act, and we will...
We did not manage to find allies among other orc clans, and we only lost time. We no longer have the opportunity to engage in chatter, because it's time to depart. Where are we going, chieftain?
We have to go north
Our home has always been to the north
We have to go south
Perhaps, the road is going to be challenging, but we can establish our home far from the threat

The Long Road to North

Our wise decision was to head north. We cannot violate the ideals and traditions of our clan, laid down by our ancestors, because only in this way can we survive. Perhaps we will face the adventures, maybe even death... but there is no other choice.\n\nFollowing the northern road, we arrived at a place full of snow and mountains, however other creatures live here and, so cannot settle here. [root.GetTitledFirstName], it is a time to choose where we go next.
Keep going to north
The only option for us - north

we follow the first path...

After a couple of months of wandering since we were expelled from the Horde, we found our new home. We took the shore by the sea - right next to Ironforge. Undoubtedly, this is a new era for our clan. Now it's time to till the land!
Dabu!
Alterac

We will stay here

Despite the fact that the valley looks poor and we can hardly be engaged in farming, we decided to stay here. This land looks untouched, and various animals live here. The clan will get stronger exactly here before we let the world know about ourselves.
Dabu!

Go ahead!

we hit the storm!

Lord Alexei Barov goes down in Warcraft history as a famous agent of the Scourge, and one of the death knights who took their post within the Scholomance. Before the plague, however, Alexei was the lord of Caer Darrow, a keep constructed in the middle of Darrowmere Lake in Lordaeron, and it is perhaps the oldest standing human monument on Azeroth. Dark magic is stirring, and Lord Alexei's mind has already been corrupted by the Cult of the Damned. Can Lord Barov be redeemed by the Light, or will he become one of million other victims of the Lich King's Scourge?

King Thoras Trollbane is the grand warrior-king of Stromgarde. Originally, he led Stromgarde to be one of the founding members of the Alliance of Lordaeron, but due to disagreement with King Terenas, Thoras Trollbane retracted Stromgarde's membership. These diagreements, however, did not stop Stromgarde from becoming one a heroic contender in the Second War. Trollbane personally led his troops to cut off the Horde in Alterac, preventing them from overwhelming the Capital City of Lordaeron, though a good part of Stromgarde lay in ruin.

Father of Varian Wrynn and King of Stormwind and Azeroth during the Second War. A grand portion of his reign was addled by dooming prophecies from Medivh, the Guardian. He spoke of how the prosperity of Azeroth was soon at an end. With the rise of Blackhand as Warchief, the war against the Orcs has taken a desperate turn. Will Azeroth protect against the Horde of Black Morass, or shall it fall as Medivh predicted so long ago?
Awaken C'thun
Your master slept too long. It's time to awaken him.

Your slightly eccentric liege has proclaimed a new law that is to be upheld throughout the realm. It reads:

"Whereas the children of the realm have become desensitised to violence, and: whereas the general populace seems to have lost all regard for the sanctity of life:

Therefore I, [From.GetTitledName], decree that all forms of violence directed at other reasonable beings be outlawed, including both capital and corporal punishment as well as the torture of criminals, heathens and foreigners. These vulnerable social groups are instead to be rehabilitated and eventually released back into society as productive citizens."

The new law has been written and couriers are even now distributing it to all of your vassals. You admire your handiwork:

"Whereas the children of the realm have become desensitised to violence, and: whereas the general populace seems to have lost all regard for the sanctity of life:

Therefore I, [From.GetTitledName], decree that all forms of violence directed at other reasonable beings be outlawed, including both capital and corporal punishment as well as the torture of criminals, heathens and foreigners. These vulnerable social groups are instead to be rehabilitated and eventually released back into society as productive citizens."
Your days are over.

Invite Remaining Clans
A lot of orcs left beyond the Dark Portal. We need all the clans, if we want to gain a foothold in Azeroth.
Greatest Gift
The Old Gods have gave you their mercy, but you're still far from perfect. Only the most worthy are able to get the ideal form, the crown of evolution and adaptation to the cruel world.

It's time to stop this carnage. The Horde has conquered enough land to start a new life in Azeroth. Many orcs are returning to their families, burying their axes into the ground. They have vowed to forget the horrors of war that they have had to go through. The Warlords of the Horde still pose a threat to some parts of Azeroth, but the bloodiest wars are behind us.
It's over...

For some time now, my [GetFromRelation] [From.GetTitledFirstName] has been avoiding me. [From.GetSheHeCap] has not visited my bedchamber for several weeks. Having left their homelands during the chaos of the Third War, the human settlers of Theramore have since then adapted into a new environment. The intermingling of various human cultures in the young kingdom has led to the formation of a new united identity.
Long live Theramore!

The orcish settlement of Kalimdor has brought all the orcish clans of the Horde into one nation of Durotar. For many years, members of these clans coexisted with each other in an united effort to build their new homeland, leading to form an Orcish identity that is above the divisions of the clans, but instead focusing on the strong, united Orcish civilization.
Glory to Durotar!
